review.reviewBody: I have had these shoes for about 3 months now and absolutely love them. Great for everyday, long distance, and light to moderate trails including the beach. They were also great for general walking as i wore them in an amusement park for 12+ hours and my feet felt great at the end of the day.
review.name: Pleasantly surprised, great shoe!
comment: Thank you for sharing your review with us.

review.reviewBody: Really like the performance of this shoe for interval work on the local  400 Meter Track
review.name: Great Shoe for the Track and Trail
comment: Thanks for the great feedback!

review.reviewBody: Just wish there was a waterproof version. Barefoot shores are the way your feet should feel in shoes. It bound and restrained.
review.name: The way shoes should feel
comment: Thank you for the rating!

review.reviewBody: Having worn the vaporglove exclusively for the past 5 years, it was bit of a transition. Not nearly as much ground feel and flex, but way more protection and warmth. I still prefer the vaporgloves, but these will probably become my go to shoes for colder weather.
review.name: Vapor to Trailglove Transition
comment: We value your feedback tremendously.

review.reviewBody: Four months of light use and the sole has worn through.  Very expensive shoes that wear out like a cheap pair of dollar store shoes.  My past ones i loved and were over four years old.  Disappointed i will be looking elsewhere.
review.name: Sole is worn through after  few months light use
comment: We're sorry to hear this happened to you. We stand behind our products and we'd love to do all we can to help. We have a 1 year warranty on our products for any manufacturing defects. Please visit our ‘Contact Us’ page at the link below and fill out the Warranty Form to start a claim. We can also help at 800-288-3124 if you need any assistance.  Thank you. https://shorturl.at/yPFaG

review.reviewBody: Yeah the tread wears too quickly on these newer trail glove versions; otherwise love the shoe!!
review.name: Tread wears quickly

review.reviewBody: I chose the Vapor Glove 7 because of some special needs on my side. I have a mobility issue and use a cane most of the time. I found that, with regular sneakers, because I was higher off the ground I was more prone to stumbling because the sole 'grabbed' the pavement so effectively and I did not 'feel' the walking surface. The Vapor Glove has been very effective in reducing my stumbling...not exactly a feature that the Merrell Marketing folk would want to emphasize :) In addition, because I can frequently drag one foot when walking, the outsole, with the wraparound feature at the toe prevents excessive wear in that area. A purchaser might want to consider a half size down from their regular sneaker size because of the more rounded toe design with the Vapor Glove. I have to use an insole even though I acquired the exact size as my regular sneaker. It also takes a little getting used to with the thinner outsole and more rounded design. These might be more related to my personal circumstance but is worth noting. Overall a very good sneaker for my unique situation.
review.name: Good for my unusual issue

review.reviewBody: Great quality and comfort. The issue is sizing. I’m normally a 81/2 in any regular shoe but heard these fit big. I got a half size smaller but still find they are too big in the forefoot. Wish I had got a full size smaller ( 71/2) instead of 8. Other than that I think they’re pretty good.
review.name: Sizing is off

review.reviewBody: Love these!  Fit great and ready to go right out of the box.
review.name: Super shoe!
comment: Thank you so much for your kind words!

review.reviewBody:
The sole picks up too much mud in some conditions, but I threw them away after stepping in dog poop. Although this is a bad day for any shoe, I could not bring myself to deal with the intricate maze of crap that this sole became. 
I have liked the trail gloves of the past, and the fit and style of this one is otherwise pleasing enough, but I wouldn't buy shoes with this pattern sole again.
review.name: Not these soles!

name: Trail Glove 7 Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought a large thinking this would be enough of a size up and I was wrong. The large size was way too tight at the crotch area which is not a flattering look and it felt uncomfortable. Unsure if I will re-order the XL or just go with another brand.
review.name: Runs way too small!

review.reviewBody: First thought is I should have ordered two sizes up rather than one compared to my other bibbs to obtain maximum comfort. Second concern is a seam around the men’s kickstand area. This is just enough to make it a noticeable distraction. Rode a short 35 mile ride and that’s my opinion of the product.
review.name: Unfortunately a little disappointed

review.reviewBody: Bought these as a gift and will have to return. They run a size smaller and surprisingly the front and sides is see-through.
review.name: Run smaller

review.reviewBody:
I bought these Castelli Endurance 3 bib shorts after seeing positive reviews from multiple sources, which also noted that they run small.  I generally get a Large in riding shorts, occasionally even a Medium, so after double checking the sizing chart I went with XL.  The thigh binding was snug almost to the point of cutting circulation and the straps felt tight on my shoulders.  I coincidentally discovered an older pair of Castelli bibs that I bought some time ago. They are also XL and they fit ok, except the straps are thinner than I'd like. So it seems they've shrunk their sizings over time!  I'd recommend getting two sizes larger than normal if you'd like to try these.  Personally, I think I'll go back to Rhapha- better fit and cheaper price.
Note: Backcountry has a generous 90-day return policy, though I have to pay for shipping.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: These short have the potential to be my go to everyday shorts if it weren't for one major design flaw. As others have mentioned, the modesty panel in the front is much shorter than other shorts out there. The problem isn't a modesty thing though, it's a comfort issue. Because it's so short it puts the stitching in the one place you don't want it, right on your "soldier". Luckily I only went on a short 30 mile ride and even with that it about rubbed me raw. Glad I didn't do my long ride today!
review.name: Great shorts with one MAJOR design flaw

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my boyfriend to replace similar ones by the same Italian company. He reports they are fantastic. They run SMALL so definitely order at least one Dixie larger than usual.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: I ordered medium and large after reading other reviews and sure enough I could barely get the mediums on and they are on their way back to Backcountry.  The large fits well. I have done a couple of rides and they feel great.
review.name: Comfortable but runs small

review.reviewBody: Premium pad without breaking the bank, runs a little small but great if you like compression bibs
review.name: Bought two already

review.reviewBody: I really do love these. Sizing up for sure, but even then it will be tight especially on the shoulder straps. These are comfortable and should be worn in the biking position, this it's right when standing up.
review.name: Amazing pair of bib shorts

review.reviewBody: These are best bibs I ever worn for long distance riding, after 30 miles no butt pain or discomfort.
review.name: Endurance 3 Bib shorts

name: Endurance 3 Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Think about that:

Weighs like Arc's Atom lt, warm (if not warmer) as Atom AR.
Compressed like a down jacket, windproof, highly  breathable.

That's Oreus, which is really a revolution. 

It's definitely the best synthetic jacket I've ever owned ( I own Arc's Atom Lt/AR, Pata's Nano air, micro puff & Das light and Northface's Summit Ventrix)

hasVariant.description: Buy the SealLine Discovery 5-50L Dry Bag online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have to 50L version, and this bag doesn't disappoint. I added 4 dring hooks to this bag with HH-66 adhesive and now I have a myriad of options to carry the bag too. 
Very durable, and 3 rolls provides a very tight seal.
review.name: A good bag, that can easily be made better

review.reviewBody: Replacing my original bag, not the same although it works, I’m on the water now, San Clemente island
review.name: New gear bag

review.reviewBody: Love these dry bags. They are durable and simple. If you do different activities including kayaking, hiking, motorcycling, you name it...but an assortment of different sizes as these bags always come in handy. I highly recommend these.
review.name: Love these dry bags, they are super practicle!

review.reviewBody: I bought my first SealLine dry bag 40 years ago and it still does the job. This is a great product you can enjoy for decades.
review.name: Robust Construction!

review.reviewBody: As expected the bag design and features are great, I am simply not a fan of the material used and would of prefered a baja bag. I guess i could say that I settled for second best...
review.name: Ok, but not what I needed

review.reviewBody:
The quality I have come to expect and enjoy from Seal Line.

I use Seal Line bags at work and for recreation.

Purchase and receipt without flaw.
review.name: The quality I have come

review.reviewBody: Its a good product quality/price. Just by looking and touching at the material, It is obviously not the top of the line but it seems to do the job so far.
review.name: Its a good product quality/price.

review.reviewBody: The Discovery dry bag was a great addition to my everyday paddling setup. The ovicular shape of the bag makes it easier to close and seal. I would recommend the Discovery or the Baja dry bag.
review.name: Seal Line makes some quality products

review.reviewBody: Seal line bags are the premium in wet/dry bags. Hands down !
review.name: Absolutely

review.reviewBody: At first this bag seemed like an impenetrable barrier. Designed pretty well with good materials. Got it for Christmas 2018 and havent been able to use it until recently. Figuring it was brand spanking new and didnt seem to have any issues, I put my even newer Canon DSLR wrapped in a shirt in the bag. Sealed it up airtight and correctly (I've used dry bags for many years... I know how to seal them) put it in the back of the raft and strapped it top-end up to the seat. Did not use or access the bag for about 6 hours. The bottom of the raft had a bit of standing water and apparently that was enough for the seam to trickle in water and put about an inch of water into the bottom of the bag. As it turns out an inch of water is also enough to completely ruin a brand new camera. Used similar drybags from other brands for the identical purpose and never had an issue in years. Just beware, it may be a ""dry bag"" but apparently its seams are not completely waterproof. Do NOT put anything valuable or electronic in these bags. Just watching out for other consumers. Hope this helps someone! Planning on contacting the company when I find time to see if there could be a possible resolution. I'll keep this updated.
review.name: Bummed out consumer.

name: Discovery 5-50L Dry Bag

hasVariant.description: Buy the POC Joint VPD Air Elbow Pads online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great elbow pads! They don't pinch, dig in, or roll. Every few laps I have to pull them up a little but the two grip strips on the interior do a good job of keeping them in place.
review.name: Nice and light

review.reviewBody: Bought a medium, I'm 5'8" & honestly had trouble getting the pad over my watch. Kind of disappointing b/c I previously bought the ION E-Pact elbow pad size (M) & that one ran even smaller.  This POC AIR I could at least get it on my elbows.  However I never used & will exchange it for a large.  I want something to help with crash rash / minor impacts.  The POC sizing seemed larger than the E-Pact, which by a tiny bit it was - but I would advise you size up to be safe, it has a strap / elastic to help keep the pad on the arm if it runs a bit large by sizing up.
review.name: Good elbow pad that's not huge; size up

review.reviewBody:
I really like these pads, I don't notice them at all while riding. Have not had a crash with them yet (luckily) and have ridden around 5-8 times with them. 

I recommend choosing your size based on the forearm measurement, not the bicep. Based on forearm, I was at upper end of medium (11.75") but based on bicep measurement would be a large. I saw other reviews of people complaining about them sliding down so I opted for the medium and I'm glad I did. They stay in place for me even without the straps while not being uncomfortable tight, and don't go over your biceps anyway.
review.name: Good lightweight pads

review.reviewBody:
I?m wearing these pads on every ride, and they don?t bother me at all, even in hot weather. They fit me very well, and don?t move at all.

I?ve ?tested? them twice in a crash, landing on my elbow/forearm in both cases at high enough speed to slide a little. Excellent protection both times, walked away without a scratch.
review.name: Comfortable and good protection

review.reviewBody: I want to like these elbow pads but they just don?t stay in place. By the end of a descent they are around my wrists no matter how tight I make the Velcro strap. Seems like it would make sense to add a strap to the upper arm as well.
review.name: Don?t stay put

review.reviewBody: I just rode 2 full hardcore downhill days and a 25 mile xc day and was so glad to have the pads. They paid for themselves already. A little irritating on the arm occasionally but the shape keeps them in place plus you have the straps.  I originally ordered the g-force but the fit was not good.  My friends had g force pads as rental equipment and they were constantly round their ankles.  Very pleased with my purchase.
review.name: There when you need them and barely know

review.reviewBody: I have a hard time finding elbow guard that would fit me. Everything ends up loose. My biceps is 9 inches and this XS fit me perfectly. If I wear this over my sun sleeve then it fit snugly. If your biceps is bigger than 9 inches, I would recommend you go for size S or bigger.
review.name: Fit tiny arms

review.reviewBody:
I?m using these for flatland skating and they provide plenty of protection for my purposes. The guides on POC?s website suggested I order Medium, which turned out to be comically small.  The large ones fit well and I have had no problem with slipping. They have a strap around the bottom that can be cinched down for those who need it. I find this mostly a hassle as it can tangle a little when you?re putting them on.

My only complaint is that they make my arms sweat more than my old hardshell ones did.
review.name: Pretty good, if sweaty

name: Joint VPD Air Elbow Pads

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love these but they kind of looked like clown feet (Ronald McDonald) because of the design. I ordered a M6/W7 based on reviews that they run small (I wear 6.5 normally) but they were a little too big. When worn without socks my heel would slip out when I walk, unless I tightened the toggle super tight but then it would dig into my heels. Plus they would likely stretch out a little over time. The inside were soft and cozy, and it would have been the perfect slip on to go shoe. Plus they are waterproof! so sad they didn't work for me.
review.name: I had high hopes

review.reviewBody: These shoes are the best. They are so comfortable, durable and match more of my outfits than originally thought. I wear them everyday to work - I love ❤️ them!
review.name: Another Excellent, Great Ugg Shoe

review.reviewBody: Runs a bit small, hate that I have to wait on another size to come in. I hope the next size up is enough
review.name: I would buy again, knowing how they run now.

review.reviewBody: Love them! I would say go up a size if you want them to be real comfortable, they are snug.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: Not only do they look good but there very comfortable I love wearing them with jeans and cargos
review.name: I get lots of compliments on these

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my husband and these are his words: they're comfortable; they're warm; they tighten-up to keep out the cold, rain, slush, & snow and have a balanced sole and toe bumper. Plus, they look great, sloshing or not!
review.name: COLD FEET NEEDING COMFORT AND WARMTH? BUY ME

review.reviewBody: For a chunky footwear, this is unbelievably comfortable and stylish, the grip is top notch too. As good as it looks on the site, it's even better looking physically. A 10/10 for me
review.name: I love this uggs sooooo much

review.reviewBody: I am 5'10" and 200lbs this shoe looked to bulky. I had to return.
review.name: Too bulky

review.reviewBody: I recommend sizing up as the lining of the shoe that's on top of the foot is very tight. When you press down it gives relief but still is uncomfortable. Very stiff shoe. I will try to break them in because I really like them. My dad also had the same problem as well. I'll come back to update in case they become comfortable.
review.name: Size up!

review.reviewBody: Shoe arrived broken, 10% was offered. Couldn't be switched for another pair as my size was out of stock. Minimum of 30% should have been offered, I love the shoe and took it to a shoe repair. Ugg handles customer issues poorly.
review.name: Shoe arrived broken

description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Ghost Whisperer 2 Vest - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ghost Whisperer 2 Vest - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Ghost Whisperer 2 Vest - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I picked it up at a fair price and probably wouldn't have bought it otherwise. I'm glad I took advantage of the sale. It's a nice simple vest with a good fill count. I'm not really a vest wearing kind of guy, but my son says this one looks great on me. The color gives Marty McFly vibes, but I like that. It contrasts nicely with dark greens, whites and blacks.
review.name: Sale price was so nice that it didn't feel like I paid twice.

review.reviewBody: I received my men's small Ghost Whispered 2 vest today. Weight is 5.1oz. It's the same fine quality of my Ghost Whisperer 2 sweater that weighs 8.0 oz. They are roomy enough for layers under and the most packable layers that I own. Kudos to MH for a home run.
review.name: Home run MH

review.reviewBody: I have the pants and jacket. This vest is no let down. Same great weight and quality. Love it.
review.name: Another great ghost whisperer product

review.reviewBody: I am a 5'11, 200lbs, athletic build and the Large fits perfect. A little room for movement but enough snug to hold the warm air close. Very light weight, perfect pack along for the extra warmth needed while taking a rest or just to take the edge off if the temperature drops. Fits nicely under rain gear. Will be taking this all over the Alps and Rockies for many years to come.
review.name: Best Vest

review.reviewBody: Fits and looks good.  I am average build 6’1” 185-190-lbs and purchased a large.  I wear a sweatshirt under it and fit is ideal.  Quality is good but zipper looks like it might not stand the test of time.  If it does it would go up to 4-1/2 to 5 stars.  Sale price was a big bonus.
review.name: Very Happy

review.reviewBody: I love this vest. The sizing is correct and it is very warm. They could have made the zippers little more "heavy duty, but regardless it's a great buy especially on sale!
review.name: Very elegant and warm

review.reviewBody: Perfect for layering, this vest is incredibly lightweight and keeps you warm. It is a great functional piece whether you only have one long-sleeve layer understand or multiple thin layers.
review.name: Lightweight and Warm Vest

review.reviewBody: Just like the full ghost whisperer puffy, this is a great additional piece. However, note that it runs large, so I usually always wear medium, but this had to down sized to small.
review.name: Great. Runs large.

review.reviewBody: Great vest.  Disastrous return process- 45 days to get a return?!
review.name: Returns process is a mess with Mtn HW.

review.reviewBody:
5'11", 170lb guy, 32(ish) in waist.

Bought a medium based on sizing guide, and fit through shoulders, chest and waist were spot on.

Strange thing about fit is that vest is cut long, and ends 5 or 6" lower than my waist. As a result, lower hem of vest is tight over my thighs/ glutes, creating a feeling of slight restriction and causing rest of vest to ride up... 

If it fits, I'm sure it would be dope!
review.name: Lovely Quality- strange fit (for me)

name: Ghost Whisperer 2 Vest - Men's

review.reviewBody: I was disappointed by this particular Rap article of clothing. First of all, it is definitely not what one would consider a "sweatshirt." It is a very thin shirt, more like a light base layer. Due to the thin material, the zip-up collar flopped around in an unflattering way if it was not zipped up all the way. It also seems to run small. It is advertised as "slim fit," but I typically wear a Small in Rab tops, and this was snug on me in Medium. Color was great, but I returned it.
review.name: Not really as advertised

name: Lineal Pull-On Sweatshirt - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought the 30L cannot update my review on that bag because backcountry system will not allow it even though customer service instructed me to do so. They offered no compensation after I contacted them.  Im not happy with their quality having paid for the bag to get two months of use. We started carrying a Nalgene silo for two days and it was too snug we switched to a skinny bottle. The water bottle pocket stinks. The fabric of the bag is sticky and bottles cannot slide in and out. The mesh isn’t stretchy then becomes stretched out.  The bag is coming apart at the seams around the water bottle pocket. There is now a hole in the bag. 2 months of going to school. Really stinks. Customer service offered nothing   I won’t  buy backcountry products again.
review.name: Not if you carry water

review.reviewBody:
I would never recommend that backpack for hiking. It’s heavy as it is and very stiff , does not shape  to your back , does not have security belt by the waist , it makes it so unstable. I just ended 13 mile hike on PCT with horrible back  pain from unstable weight distribution. Zippers are jamming so it’s hard to get fast to bottle of water or whatever you need from backpack. 
For short  trips …. Maybe 🤔 
I love colors and fabric, that’s about it.
review.name: Backpack Destination 20l

review.reviewBody: Great simple pack, exactly as shown. I bough primarily because I couldn't find my Patagonia BlackHole 25L I use for flight travel and was looking for a cheaper option, but in the end am returning this one because I found my other pack, but compared to my other they are both fairly similar in size and utility, except this Backcountry Destination 20L is quite a bit cheaper and has space for a water bladder, and can fit a larger laptop. I almost kept this as a second/backup pack but already have too many. Great for a simple pack that can transition from office the gym to the trail, but in my opinion a little too rugged/outdoor-looking for use as everyday carry laptop bag for professional / white-collar customer meetings. Perfect size for airport airplane travel, will fit underseat to and a perfect 2nd travel-back to complement a roll-aboard that would go in the overhead.
review.name: Great simple pack

review.reviewBody: The video explaining this pack was a great influencer.  I really like the look and feel.
review.name: Smooth Company

review.reviewBody: Looks bigger and fills more than what I think the average 20L would be - great quality construction and materials. Easily rivals the black hole patagonia pack I’ve had for years and replaced with this. Love!
review.name: Solid pack!

review.reviewBody: The dimensions listed are 13 x 16 x 5in.  Unfortunately, it is 19 inches tall and thus not eligible to fly as a personal item as desired.
review.name: Dimensions not accurate

review.reviewBody: This backpack is well-designed with a giant main compartment and a few strategically placed zip pockets, as well as side pockets for water bottles, etc.  It's a comfortable fit when full and weightless when empty.
review.name: Roomy cute backpack

review.reviewBody: The design of this bag is optimal for travel purposes. You can fit a surprising amount of clothing in the main compartment while also carrying a laptop, laptop accessories, and a water bottle. Good, rigid structure as well.
review.name: Fantastic Travel Backback

review.reviewBody:
Plenty of room. I take this in the park all the time. With room for a collapse helmet jacket n battery pack. I have fallen multiple times and it's really durable and waterproof.

Not worth a hundred dollars waiting till it's on sale to buy

Ps the 30L with hip straps is way better fir price
review.name: Great hydra pac

review.reviewBody: My climbing gear has been loose in my trunk since I started climbing 6 months ago. I bought this to remedy that and it works perfectly. The zippers are heavy duty and the construction is fantastic, I can’t recommend this bag enough.
review.name: Great pack!

name: Destination 20L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Im happy with it , cool design, doesn’t move while running
review.name: Cool design

review.reviewBody: Excellent vest with get organization structure.  Customer service was amazing.
review.name: Great product. Even better customer service

review.reviewBody: This is my first hydration vest. I have to say I love it. I am new to running and had a spibelt previously that bounced too much. This vest does not bounce at all, feels secure and has so many pockets for whatever I may need to carry while on my long runs.
review.name: New runner

review.reviewBody: I needed a vest for shorter runs (< 8 miles) that would still have room for my phone, keys, ID, water and a snack or two if needed. I fell in love with the white and aqua colorway and it looks even better in person! This fits true to size and doesn’t bounce at all.
review.name: Great for shorter runs!

review.reviewBody:
Just tried this product today - it holds all my essentials and the pockets are very accessible. The mesh pockets in the back is a neat feature. However, I find that the vest is still quite bouncy even when I have tighten the strings.

I will update my review after I have used this for my full marathon.
review.name: Works but still bouncy

review.reviewBody: I’m size 8-10 and order small is a great fit with stuff in it not too tight and doesn’t bounce a lot.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: I bought a 12L and love it too. Way easier on my back than a back pack.  I only use it for hiking
review.name: Saves lower back pain.

review.reviewBody: Needed something for long runs that was small enough to be comfortable but still hold everything I need and this was perfect!
review.name: Perfect fit!

review.reviewBody: I have a 12 L version of this bag too. It’s awesome way better than wearing a backpack for a long hikes.
review.name: Tight fit but awesome

review.reviewBody:
After quite a bit of research I decided to buy the Salomon ADV SKIN . My other pack, from a well known hydration bidons & bladders/packs, rubbed against my collarbones and left wounds. This pack so far has been a bit more gentle.

My only issue with this pack is thet I wish the front zipped pocket wasn't see through. Don't exactly want to advertise my debit card or other valuables. ;)
review.name: So far so good

review.itemreviewed: x Selle Italia SLR Boost Kit Carbonio Superflow Saddle
review.reviewBody: Purchased this past summer to replace the stock saddle on a Pinarello F5. It was a major improvement and well worth the price. Super lightweight and one of the most comfortable saddles I’ve ridden.
review.name: Great saddle

review.itemreviewed: x Selle Italia SLR Boost Kit Carbonio Superflow Saddle
review.reviewBody:
Comfort on the road bike can be .. challenging, to say the least.  At firsthand - yes that largely depends on the effort; one person could be chugging along doing 120 watts and be perfectly content and someone else could be content doing their FTP interval training at 420 watts for 20min (sufferfest).  Comfort is all relevant.  Or is it?  

Something those riders have in common outside of fitness, outisde of bike geometries, is body - to - bike fit relative to components (aka touchpoints).  Yeah - a bike fit is basically the solution there, and I would encourage everyone to get one!  but - when it comes to SADDLE COMFORT - boy all reason can go out the window.  Few questions might come to mind:  "which is the lightest?"  "do I get one that's 3D printed"?  and most importantly, "which saddle looks the coolest?"  
There are TONS of resources to alleviate saddle discomrt - a few being around the topics of;  sit-bone measurement, flexibility, hip positioning, and lastly - princepoint, are all the best ways to narrow down the selection.  

I love this saddle.  and not just because it looks cool, not because it's stupidly lightweight, and not because the Enve logo is on it.  Much like many riders i know, I've gone through countless saddles to find what works best for me.  My current road bike (R5) I've had 4 different saddles (Fizik Arione, Fizik Antares (3d printed), s-works power mirror (3d printed)) and still not ideal comfort.  This saddle shape was exactly what I was looking for - and allows great hip movement.  it's insanely lightweight, and the channel relief is unlike all others I've ridden.  Hope this helps, have a great ride.
review.name: Cinderella Slipper's Saddle

name: x Selle Italia SLR Boost Kit Carbonio Superflow Saddle

review.reviewBody: These are the warmest pants I have ever owned. As an outdoor enthusiast in Northern Michigan I am pleased to own a pair of pants that keeps my bum warm while snowshoe hiking and fat tire biking.
review.name: Great warmth!

review.reviewBody: I purchased these on sale. When I got time I thought they were too thin. However, I have worn them several times in 20F weather and wind and they are one of the warmest pair of pants I’ve worn. Very happy.
review.name: Warm!

review.reviewBody: I often camp in very cold conditions for work (25 degrees Fahrenheit at times) and bought these to keep me warm at night. They do the job but also, I don’t sweat in them. They’re exactly what I needed. They’re so cozy that I often find myself wearing them at home.
review.name: Cozy and Warm While Camping in Winter

review.reviewBody: Soft, warm, and nice to look at. 5’3 and XS fit well.
review.name: Ski town all star

review.reviewBody: He loved them the moment he put them on. He loves how adjustable and customizable the fit is - with or without black socks! LOL
review.name: A hit with the hubs!

review.reviewBody: I've owned Teva Sandals off and on since they were first introduced. I've logged hundreds (if not thousands) of miles wearing Tevas over the years. The Hurrican XLT2 reminds me of the original Tevas I used to wear back in the '90s. Comfortable, holds my foot in place, no slipping when hiking, great traction, and durable.
review.name: Love my new Tevas! I'll definitely buy these again!

review.reviewBody: Where the heck do I start...I'm on my Hawaii trip and I just got down from doing the Koko Head trail in these sandals. I'm more dehydrated than banana chips but dang these sandals are an absolute beast of a product. These things were still very comfy after 2000 stairs and 1600 ft of elevation change. These sandals also worked well at the beach, on sand and shore. 20000 steps almost every day? Oh yeah I have the Hurricane XLT2s. Worth the purchase and once these are worn out I'm buying another pair.
review.name: Absolute banger

review.reviewBody: I just started wearing Tevas this year and I'm a convert, now up to four pair. They provide great support for my feet which helps the rest of my legs. Can walk for miles!
review.name: Love Hurricanes

review.reviewBody: I love the fit and how they feel on my feet, but got sent the wrong size, returned them on aug 13th and have not received the right size yet
review.name: I would buy this again

review.reviewBody: Mainly use this for kayaking, canoeing or stream walking
review.name: I would buy this again

review.reviewBody: I love Teva;s but I had to return the last order because they sent the wrong size and I have not recived the right size pair yet
review.name: I would buy over and over

review.reviewBody: I am a summer camp director and these shoes are perfect.
review.name: Great, comfortable and clock many miles in these!

review.reviewBody: I always knew Teva 's were comfortable.But couldn't get past the basis black look.I this are so fashionable .
review.name: My first pair .I love them .

review.reviewBody: The moment I put these sandals on I was hooked! Instant comfort! That doesn't happen very often. I will definitely buy other colors and styles when I need to. I am a true size 7 and the fit is perfect.
review.name: My absolute favorite!!!

review.reviewBody: These boots appear to be good quality but were too narrow for my feet. I usually wear a 10.5 shoe in a traditional width. The only time I've ever ordered a wide width is when ordering Salomon boots/shoes. Thankfully Expedition Perks allows me to return at no charge.
review.name: Nice boots but too narrow

review.reviewBody: Comfortable to wear and walk around in, very good traction on hikes.  I've worn them when it's in the low 20's and my feet stayed warm.  I would buy again.
review.name: These are great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Been needing good, warm winter boots for a while and these are absolutely perfect. Kept my feet warm and dry in cold, wet conditions. Did not require any breaking in and fit perfectly to size.
review.name: Get the job done

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am a dog walker who puts on about 10 miles a day onto my shoes. These are super lightweight and keep my feet dry (mostly). I wish they had more arch support and were a tad more breathable (my feet end up sweating and then my socks get wet from that versus snow and water intrusion. 
They’re great for snowy days where the snow isn’t too high.
review.name: Lightweight & waterproof, needs more arch support

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the boots. They are extremely light, flexible, and as comfortable as a pair of tennis shoes. No break in period needed. They’re awesome.
review.name: Out of the box.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I didn’t think a could find boots for my husband that were both practical for winter and stylish enough to wear out so when I came across these I knew they were perfect. I got these as an early Christmas gift and he’s been raving about them! The color is awesome and a nice break from basic black or brown. He’s told me several times how comfortable they are, which is rare for him to say. Such a great value for quality Columbia boots. Super happy with these boots!
review.name: Very Comfortable and Stylish

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The boot is really comfy and has a stylish outlook. This fits in all varieties of clothing; sweatpants, trousers and jeans. Has a comfy interior as well. I would definitely recommend buying this shoe. You won’t regret.
review.name: Great Comfy Stylish Winter Boot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These boots are great. They look good and have kept my feet warm in 30 degree weather with only traditional socks on. They were a little snug width wise at first but they have loosened up after 2-3 wears and are very comfortable now. I tested them out in rainy conditions and they held up great with no water issues.
review.name: Columbia Omni Heat Boot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We ordered these for our son and he LOVES them! A+
review.name: Excellent boot!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing product and excellent quality. The boots look great and they are protect me from the cold weather very well.
review.name: Amazing boots

name: Fairbanks Omni-Heat Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Bought for my son. He loves it. Size is a lilttle big.
review.name: Body Bag

review.reviewBody: I’ve been eyeing one of these basically since they released and finally bit the bullet! The sizing is generous but that’s not a bad thing and contributes to the warmth. My sole complaint is that the way one of my arms was sewn created a weird funnel I have to shove my hand through but it isn’t uncomfortable once on. Definitely recommend!
review.name: So comfy!

review.reviewBody: I'm 6' 210 lbs with big legs and the S/M fits me quite well, just a tiny bit tight through the thighs but can still wear them comfortably w/ a thinner underlayer (shorts, leggings etc). I also got the L/XL (don't judge me), which is very long (I need to bungie the legs to keep them up) but that size is my preferred size for couch lounging.
review.name: Awesome item, just double-think sizing

review.reviewBody: I am not saying they're a bad product. They look good, they're awesome to walk around, warm and cozy. But to sleep in these was torture. For me and my wife. Both had the worst sleep of our lives in 0*C (which i think is 32F?)....I dont know. We got them half price so we aint going to complain a lot, but I would go with a sleeping bag. Unless you want something to walk around the camp.
review.name: We hated them.

review.reviewBody:
This Bivy suit is a game changer as someone who is always cold but loves to be in the snow this suit is everything I've ever wanted and more. This item has an intentional oversized fit to allow space for layering on those extremely cold nights as well as for using it as a sleeping bag if needed by sealing up the foot and hand areas. You can tighten down the ankles to ensure you dont drag any fabric when going for a walk for us shorter folks. 

I'm 5'3" and 125 lbs and bought the XXS/XS for myself and the L/XL for my husband who is 200lbs and 6'4. We waited for our Crepes a la Cart in Breckenridge in these suits, while every one was huddled around the fire pit we were perfectly toasty on a snowy night. I ended up having to buy two more for my In-Laws because we travel together in our RV's and they were jealous of our suits when walking the dogs in frigid temps, now everyone is happy and warm. My only feedback would be to make like a zipped dropper seat like what you see in snow bibs so when you need to use the bathroom you dont have to struggle, esp for the ladies. I fortunately have a she-wee funnel to replicate peing like a guy hahah which is honestly hilarious to use when I camp but makes it easy at times. 

This is made with Synthetic insulation so it will still retain warmth even if it gets wet. Seriously buy this item, you wont regret it.
review.name: Amazing for frigid walks or cold camping

review.reviewBody: Bought 2 of these suits on sale, one to sleep in and lounge around the house in winter. The other I will use for outdoor activities in cold weather. Have tried 2 other brands of similar suits, but I like this one the best. It is roomy, warm and comfortable. I am 5ft 9in 150 lbs and the s/m fits well with some room to spare.
review.name: Great for cold weather

review.reviewBody: This thing is awesome! I bought it to wear to my kid’s spring softball and baseball games here in Montana. I’m 5’2, 125lbs and the xxs/xs is roomy but fits fine. My daughter plans to use it during hunting season on those super cold mornings when she is posted up in a field and waiting for a deer.
review.name: So warm!

review.reviewBody:
Got this for my MIL, as she is always wearing thermals.
She used it that first night at a lake near Yosemite, and she loved it. She was toasty warm.
review.name: Keeps you warm

review.reviewBody: I bought this for camping, the always cold and windy softball games, and other cold events. I’m 5’4”, I bought an XS/S it’s a bit too long but you can pinch the ankles tight with the built in bungees. The arms are also a bit long but I like that it easily folds over my hands. You can easily wear pants and a hoody underneath this but I’d only do that for very cold temperatures. I tried it inside while WFH and I overheated. I suspect this is built for men even though the pics show a man and a woman. I love this item already and can’t wait to be too warm for a change.
review.name: So warm

review.reviewBody: It’s like a gingerbread man sleeping bag. Great to lounge  around and be cozy in. I wouldn’t go for hikes in it. I wouldn’t cook a culinary masterpiece. I’m 5’8, 130 and the SMALL is roomy, with very long arms and legs. I fold them up when walking. But the torso fits well, so go figure. For $100, I totally dig it. Use it for comfy cozy hang time. Not take over the world time. Oh, it’s super soft and light, but warm as hell!
review.name: Very nice.. for the right situation.

name: Bivy Suit
Stoic Bivy Suit | GH Review

description: Buy the Nite Ize SpotLit XL Rechargeable Collar Light online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: SpotLit XL Rechargeable Collar Light
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nite Ize SpotLit XL Rechargeable Collar Light online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought my first one for a previous dog when you needed to replace the coin batteries. The new and improved colourful one is great. Buddy is a black and white husky, making nighttime visibility impossible. Seeing a bobbing coloured light is so much easier.
Thank you.
review.name: This keeps Buddy safe.

review.reviewBody: We've had two of these in the last two months, they stopped taking a charge.  I feel they should last more than two months. They've never gotten wet, they are used for night walks with our dogs.
review.name: stopped taking a charge

review.reviewBody: I have purchase 3 since Jan 2024 it’s not used much and all of them want charge only shows orange light have tried different chargers and it’s not been getting wet an English mastiff wears this so it’s not touching the ground to get wet he only wears the collar once a day for 5 min to potty after dark the disk still look new any suggestions on why they want recharge the first one I was able to recharge a couple of times the other 2 would never charge
review.name: Have bought 3 this year want recharge
comment: Cathy, we are sorry to hear about the issue you had with the first two Spotlit XLs. We would be happy to send you replacements for each of them through our Worry-Free Guarantee. You would just need to reach out to us at info@niteize.com or via our worry-free guarantee form on the website.

review.reviewBody: Poorly constructed ,the retaining  spring on the clip fell off after a month , this is the second time I've this problem with one of these , the original ones were really good but these are of a lesser quality .
review.name: retaining  spring on the clip fell off after a mon
comment: Milo, we are sorry to hear about the trouble you had with your Spotlit XL this time around. We would be happy to replace that for you through our Worry-Free Guarantee. Just click on that form under the contact us section on our website or via email at info@niteize.com and we will make sure you are taken care of.

review.reviewBody: My dog's old LED tag stopped holding a charge for long, but this one charges quickly and lasts for hours, allowing us to make safe, leisurely inspection tours every morning. You're welcome, neighbors!
review.name: Very bright, and one charge lasts a long time

review.reviewBody: I had 2 of these lights for several years and loved them. They went bad over time. I replaced them and within a few months I got an orange light and they were no good. I moved on with another company unfortunately.  Fix the orange light issue and I will come.back.
review.name: The quality dropped
comment: We are sorry to hear about the issue you had with your Spotlit XL. We do have a worry-free guarantee on all of our products so we would be happy to replace those faulty Spotlits for you. If you reach out to us at info@niteize.com we will make sure you are taken care of.

review.reviewBody: Our lite went out for the first time tonight and it was a nice surprise to see it was recharable when I  checked for what it needed for batteries. It only took an hour and half to recharge. The first charge lasted about 2 months,using it every night for half an hour. Best bang for your buck!!!
review.name: Rechargeable  collar lite

review.reviewBody: I’ve bought at least 20 of these for my pets and friends and family members pets because they are so awesome! Your warranty is amazing
review.name: Love these lights

review.reviewBody: I live in the woods and my pups like to wander.  The XL spotlight keeps them in my sight! All 4 large pups wear one.
review.name: My pups glow!

review.reviewBody: I was super stoked to get this for my dog as he goes out in night and does his business in the small area of woods behind me. Super bright and able to see no problems. That is until it comes to the first time charging it. It doesn’t charge and this is my second one. I plug it in and light turns orange, not red, certainly doesn’t go to green. I can actually turn the light on when it’s plugged in and little charging light turns red but, as soon as you unplug, nothing. I can’t find anything that’s been done wrong. Using correct cable and a low amp/voltage brick. I just can’t recommend at this point.
review.name: Great at first…
comment: Hi there, we are sorry to hear about the issue you had with the Spotlit XL. We would be happy to help you get a replacement through our Worry-Free Guarantee. Just reach out to the Customer Service team at info@niteize.com and we can go through what is need for the Worry-Free Guarantee.

name: SpotLit XL Rechargeable Collar Light

review.reviewBody: I used this jacket to trek Kilimanjaro during the rainy season. Jacket is impenetrable, lightweight, and comfortable to wear with several ways of adjusting fit. I have recommended it to all my friends and family.

Super light weight, great fit, and incredibly wind & waterproof.  I have enjoyed so much, I purchased three more so my wife and two adult children have one too.  Wife and I walk 4 miles a day, 5-6 days a week rain or shine.  Pit zips have come in handy a few times for venting.  Great quality. Highly recommended!
review.name: Awesome jacket!

review.reviewBody: I bought an xl thinking it would fit like my other  xl rain shell from OR, I was very disappointed to find this jacket much shorter on the torso length than the previous one.
review.name: Weird sizing

review.reviewBody: It hasn’t rained since I received this jacket. It fit well, arm movement is good, and all the seams are taped. I have high hopes for this jacket, my last “rain” jacket was more like a wind breaker or maybe keep moisture off in the fog !
review.name: Looks great.

review.reviewBody: My son borrowed my first jacket and ended up keeping it (with my blessing). Had the opportunity to purchase a new shell. After hours of research, I ended up purchasing the same one, then two more of the women's versions (Aspire II) for the family. Kept my dry in constant pouring rain back backing, lightweight and packable, yet still with features like plenty of pockets and pit zips that start from the waist. The giant pit zips are great way to keep your backpack's hip belt dry in the pouring rain while still having quick access by zipping them up from the bottom about 6 inches. 6', 175 lbs - went with medium. Medium weight puffy still fit underneath. Use case: Hiking, backpacking, and around town. Use a thicker, heavier, and more durable shell for the snow environments like skiing, snowboarding, snowshoeing.
review.name: I Now Own Four of Them

review.reviewBody: I am quite disappointed in this jacket. First, why in the world does OR not build it so the hood can be stowed? There is no way to roll it up and secure it. And the hood is HUGE. I am a big bike rider and when I am riding it catches the wind and blows out. Second, it so noisy as the material is a bit stiff. Third, because the material is a crinkly and stiff it is not a comfortable jacket. What a big disappointment.
review.name: No way to stow the hood, noisy and uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: Foray Jacket and pants are a great lightweight goretex rain gear option at an amazing price point. Perfect for hiking, and tactical uses. Large oversized pit/leg vents and amazing waterproofing that will keep you dry in wet weather environments.  Would recommend this to anyone looking for versatile light packable rain gear.
review.name: Great lightweight Rain Gear

review.reviewBody: Lightweight perfect for rain or snow good fitment with middle layer and base
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Great jacket! Had one stolen and bought another.  It’s more on the light weight side and packs down to a good size while maintaining enough material to feel durable. No holes or tears after several falls. No issues with the waterproofing.
Excellent at keeping you dry. Adjustable hood works great. Plenty of breath ability, love the full length armpit zippers
review.name: Excellent jacket

name: Foray II Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.name: WindBurner Coffee Press Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR WindBurner Coffee Press Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: WindBurner Coffee Press Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR WindBurner Coffee Press Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Coffee grounds find their way around the press seal.
review.name: Coffee press lacking

review.reviewBody: This coffee press is designed to work with the Wind Burner cook kit and it does so perfectly. I brewed four cups of deliciousness this past weekend on a trip. The coffee was bright strong and delicious. I did have a few grinds make it past the filter, so the last sip was poured out to avoid the cowboy coffee sip but otherwise it was a huge hit. Pro Tip - The filter fits snugly onto the bottom of the cook pot inside of the measuring cup for storage and the two small arms get wrapped in small cloth and fit inside the cup. It's a great addition to the kit and I love mine! The weight and size are a negligible add for me for a UL[ish] bombproof backcountry setup. The Wind Burner stove itself performed so quickly there was no wait for the boiling water to make the coffee even in the 20-25 winds we had along the lake this weekend. I love mine Wind Burner rig and the addition of the coffee press gives me a complete system!
review.name: This coffee press is designed

review.reviewBody: Great French press works perfectly w the windburner
review.name: Wonderful

review.reviewBody: Nothing like fresh pressed coffee right with no grains in it.
review.name: Morning Coffeee

review.reviewBody: I love the easy compactability of this product. You can unscrew the metal rod and break it down into two pieces. These two pieces can then snap together -- fewer moving parts. My only caveat with this product is that it doesn't fit inside the stove for storage when you also have the fuel and burner stored inside. You can fit it on the bottom with the attached bowl; However, the bowl doesn't properly close thereafter so there's a higher chance of something breaking when you store it. Instead, I stored separately. Not a big deal but worth mentioning.
review.name: Convenient

review.reviewBody: Serving us well on a 10 day trip around Bryce, Zion, and the North rim of the Grand Canyon. It stows away nicely and hasn’t let a coffee ground through yet!!
review.name: Functional kit

review.reviewBody: I prefer pour-over at home, but this system is really great. I?m mostly surprised and impressed with the build quality. Functionality is great as expected.
review.name: Extremely impressed with this

review.reviewBody: Instant coffee just doesn't cut it in the backcountry... if you're like me and picky about your morning brew, this is a must-have accessory for your WindBurner. The added weight to your pack is minimal and the press packs nicely into the pots with fuel can & stove. Some reviewers here have commented that grounds get through the screen... that's not my experience and I have both press sizes (Personal and Duo Pot). French Press style brewing requires a coarse ground.. some very fine coffee sediment will get through but that's to be expected when using this method.
review.name: must have for coffee lovers

review.reviewBody: I used this for a 30 day trip to the Nordkapp. Works perfectly. Easy to store, easy to clean.
review.name: Great morning coffee.

review.reviewBody: Works great. Nothing like good coffee in the mountains!
review.name: Works great

name: WindBurner Coffee Press Kit

hasVariant.description: Buy the 686 Smarty 3-in-1 Form Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great jacket perfect as a shell and a nice warm jacket for colder days
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody:
This jacket is a great option regardless of the price point. All three configurations work in every weather condition, and I've not needed to use anything more than the jacket and a light base layer from Colorado, to California, to North Carolina skiing. It fits correctly, and I even use the liner during the off season. 
I highly recommend this jacket as the only one you'll need!
The only issue is that the thumb catch/keeper on the sleeve of the outer jacket detached within the first two days of riding. However, it was not enough of an issue to warrant sending back.
review.name: Warm, versatile and stylish

review.reviewBody: This jacket is absolutely sick! Quality is amazing, fits decent and doesn’t feel too baggy on me. Wore it one time so far and super warm in cold windy temps!
review.name: Jacket

review.reviewBody: This jacket really worked for me. Very warm lots of pockets. It kept me dry the whole day. The armpit vents helped when it got warmer in the afternoon.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: The jacket is super warm, but not overwhelming! It allows for a nice base layer without feeling constricted or needing multiple layers. I bought a size medium and it fits like a large which is perfect. The sleeves are longer and stay over my gloves without riding up to let snow in. The zip-in puffer jacket is an awesome bonus on its own. Classy looking and warm! I have had other jackets from 686 and I’m still happy with the quality. Highly recommended!
review.name: The jacket is super warm,

review.reviewBody: Love the shell and the liner. Can't beat the 2 for 1 deal.
review.name: The Best

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my grandson's birthday, year after year. He absolutely loves it. It's a shell, a sweatsuit, insulated outerwear all in one! How ingenious of 686!!!
review.name: The Absolute Best of all Outerwear!

review.reviewBody: I actually tried multiple different 3 in 1 jackets before settling on this one. I tried both the Helly Hansen Swift and the North Face Thermoball, and this 686 totally exceeds both of those in quality, apparent durability, and just general form. The 686 snaps into place at the wrists and has a much more impressive mid layer jacket. The Helly Hansen and North Face were made with a thin outer layer fabric that felt like it would rip if I brushed up against a tree; the 686 shell is thick and even feels more waterproof. 686 for the win! Only slightly negative comment is that the 686 is just a little larger than expected, would not consider it a slim fit.
review.name: Super high quality 3 in 1

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It is extremely warm and super versatile, if I’m getting hot, I just take out the inner layer and I’m good to go
review.name: It is extremely warm and

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Jacket is great, actually so great I prefer to use it separately. The base layer is really warm. With -10°C the upper layer is good enought. The versatility of both components, and the fabric of both is excellent quality. Advice: since the style is loose, I suggest to double check the size in the table. It runs bigger than expected. Both jackets together are a little too heavy, but you can use them in different combinations.
review.name: The Jacket is great, actually

name: Smarty 3-in-1 Form Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Fjallraven High Coast Wind Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: High Coast Wind Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven High Coast Wind Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Exact kind of jacket I was looking for - lightweight, packs down small and very breathable. I run quite hot when hiking, or just generally on the move, so this has worked perfectly for me.
review.name: Great for people who run on the hotter side.

review.reviewBody: Super super nice I loved …. I loved the color and the quality, it is quite rain-repellent. The only thing is that the size S that I wear feels too big, but at least I totally recom
review.name: Exelent

review.reviewBody: I really like the look and fit of this jacket, but the balky zipper is very frustrating. You have to work the zipper in a very specific way in order for the zipper to align and then pull up. This would undoubtedly work better with a single zipper pull instead of a double. I was going to return it until I figured out the magic trick that needs to be performed to get the jacket actually zipped.
review.name: Nice Jacket-Terrible Zipper.

review.reviewBody:
This is my favorite jacket!  I is lite, sheds small amounts of rain and I breaths very well.  I live in NE where we have plenty of wind so it comes in very handy.
It takes off the chill in the early morning when I walk the dog and I can wear it with an insulating piece in the late fall and early Spring.
People complain about the zipper but if you are patient you will find the zipper works just find, just make sure it clicks!
review.name: My Favorite Jacket

review.reviewBody:
The only thing i can fault with the jacket is the hood, wearing in
Light Rain the hood became fully wet inside every wear else was dry.
review.name: Rain

review.reviewBody:
Okay, l really like the look of this Jkt, l ordered the XXL size 
I’m 6’4” & 244 pounds-ish. Good fit ! I feel the arms are very 
Slightly too short depending on activity & l need to pull
Them down slightly. Layered with a t-shirt &fleece it’s a very 
Light & comfortable Jkt . Not rainproof l bought another for that 
But packs small so l pack both !! When hiking trips. 
4*’s because it needs a draw cord in the back of hood!! !
I need to ware a baseball cap 🧢 under hood to keep it in place
review.name: 4*’s because :

review.reviewBody: This jacket looks great and goes with everything. It is comfortable (lightweight/ breathable) and compactible so it is easy to pack.
review.name: Great all 'rounder

review.reviewBody: A good all rounder for spring to autumn in wind and light rain. Very comfortable to wear.
review.name: High Coast Wind Jacket

review.reviewBody: I'm a big jacket person, I have one for just about every weather situation and this is my go to in the spring and summer. It's really effective at blocking wind while I'm biking, I'll layer a fleece if it's chilly. During the summer it's the perfect weight for cool nights and keeping bugs off of you without overheating, it has light water resistance so this is definitely not a "rain jacket" but it does dry super fast if it gets wet. It packs down very small and also the perfect travel companion.
review.name: Packs down v small

review.reviewBody: Material is flexible and light, breathes and cuts the wind. I'm 6-foot-2 and 160 pounds, and glad I got the XL size, even though the sizer suggested L.
review.name: just what i wanted

name: High Coast Wind Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: these are a mesh fabric which i prefer to the sport stretchy fabric that has become so popular. i am very happy with these.
review.name: really like these

review.reviewBody: This is closer to what most over-shorts should be for riding in general. Unless you're riding in sub 60 degree weather more ventilation and less weight are ideal. The pockets are sewn to the shorts which is brilliant...there's no pockets flap loose inside your pants. They are see through in the front but most people have liners underneath so who cares. I ride to ride, not stand at the trailhead. They are also nice and long...great for those with longer legs! I sized up but think I'll buy a pair my normal size once I drop a few pounds.
review.name: what shorts should be

name: Skyline Air Short Shell - Men's

description: Buy the Thule Passage 2 Bike Strap Rack + Cradles online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Passage 2 Bike Strap Rack + Cradles
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Passage 2 Bike Strap Rack + Cradles online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I got this rack to fit my BMW 230i and works great. The only thing I needed to change is the strap that holds the rack in the horizontal plane (most fwd lip of the trunk lid). The original that comes with the rack is just a hook. If the strap loses tension, i.e. like breaking and the rack tilts fwd, it can get detached and bye bye bikes. I replaced with a different kind of strap that ends in a round stopper that gets trap inside the trunk, highly recommended: (Saris bike rack hatch huggers). Hope this helps!
review.name: Great rack! Just one improvment needed…

review.reviewBody: Great fit. I feel safe ! My bikes are secure! Thank you
review.name: Easy set up

review.reviewBody: It scares me everytime I use it but it does the job. Be carefull for your car paint !
review.name: Does the job

review.reviewBody:
Set up was easy and quick. Unfortunately the front part of my bike frame is too large for the holder and having a full suspension bike stops you from being able to use the anti-sway clip. This results in the bike not feeling like it’s securely mounted. 
This carrier would be great for a road bike or a hard-tail mtb.
review.name: Not meant for mountain bikes

review.reviewBody: Purchased about 2 months ago. Using daily. The rubber hold down straps and the carriers to hold the bike in place are not very durable.  The carriers that cradle the bike where the straps attach are not made well. Durability a major issue.  In use since 08 2023
review.name: Ok but durability of parts is poor

review.reviewBody: I purchased the 2 bike Thule passage.  It is pretty easy to install although, there is a few things I do not like.  Starting off with the fact that it has no "locking features" such as being able to lock it into my car, so it isn't so easy to steal. Literally someone can just loosen up the straps and take the bike rack with no problem.  With that being said I have to take it off when I get to my ride location, finish my ride re-install it.  Which is a small hassle but still annoying.  Another thing I do not like is that when I'm driving on the freeway my bike tends to swing.  I know it's secured but it still makes me feel un-easy.  Definitely not what I expected, then I tried to return it or exchange it, but I couldn't because I signed up for the pro-deal as an emergency responder, and now I'm stuck with a product that was not cheap and that I do not like.
review.name: It's ok.

review.reviewBody: Solid trunk rack that does what I need it to do and is compatible with many cars. I’m able to move it between different cars and also any future car I may get will likely work!
review.name: Solid trunk rack

review.reviewBody: I got this bike rack because I am moving cross country. I needed something reliable for my bike. I’m halfway through the 2500 mile trip and it’s great! I still have my bike! Super easy to load my bike and to set up the bike rack. Pleased with my purchase.
review.name: New to Thule

review.reviewBody: Great product.  Very easy to use. Gets easier each time. Very important to follow instructions.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: Pretty easy to mount once you do it the first time. Easy on, easy off. Secure fit to car and to bike. Straps are much longer than I need but maybe other users will be grateful for the extra length. Stable and secure.
review.name: Love It

name: Passage 2 Bike Strap Rack + Cradles

hasVariant.description: Buy the KUHL Konflikt Henley - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Fantastic shirt, junk Customer Service. I ordered this shirt on a Saturday morning. When it was ordered BackCountry said 3-5 business days. It finally shipped the following Tuesday afternoon with an estimated delivery of Saturday. I live a 7 hour drive from where it shipped from, it could have been put on a Wagon Train and arrived sooner. 

To add insult to injury, BackCountry continues to use DHL to ship which makes ordering from BackCountry even worse. Trying to decide if I will ever order from them again, and I’ve been a customer for a LONG time.
review.name: Kuhl Konflikt Henley

name: Konflikt Henley - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have used these gloves for cycling, horseback riding, leading horses, and hiking. Then I lost 1 glove. I was thrilled to be able to still get these so I ordered a new pair. Same excellent quality and performance as my old pair. So versatile
review.name: Had to order to replace 1 lost glove

review.reviewBody: These gloves work exactly as described.  Good in mid 30 deg to 50 deg.  Flexible, allows finger dexterity.  Works well w phone and opening/closing zippers.  Very well designed.  I read somewhere that the fingers tend to be long but I found them just right.  5' 6.5" female.  Size Small.
review.name: exactly what I wanted

review.reviewBody: These are great for early and late season rides in the mid-40s to mid-50s.  Fit is tight but correct.  Do NOT use these in real rain conditions, they become soaked through and it's like sticking your hand in ice water.  They are only suitable for spray or very light rain.
review.name: Good, but not in the rain!

review.reviewBody:
I was debating as to if I should return them as they have minimal padding. I was also dubious as to their effectiveness and temperature range. How wrong I was. The cushioning is excellent. No numb fingers, etc. I have used them five times in temps from 50 to upper 60's.'They are exceedingly versatile. They have far exceeded my expectations. Buy them!
Please note that I have big hands.
review.name: Surprisingly Excellent

name: Perfetto RoS Glove - Women's

review.reviewBody: No one likes having to tape a tubeless rim, especially one that's covered in sealant. Using a quality tape makes the job easier and this Reserve rim tape is the best quality I have found. It is super sticky, lays down easily, and with the smooth finish it encourages the tire bead to seat quickly. Save yourself the hassle of doing the job twice and just buy the right product for the job.
review.name: Excellent Quality Tubeless Tape

review.reviewBody: I have had a pair for 2 seasons. I had a total knee replaced last year so that season was shortened. This year, I have used the boots just since December and we are only in mid January. The padding in the heel space is now completely shredded in both boots. Ridiculous. I did order another pair today because I have hard feet to fit and these are very comfortable.  However I have NEVER had a boot fall apart this fast
review.name: VERY comfortable but poorly made

review.reviewBody: I replaced my cross country ski boot that I had for 20 years with these Alpina boots.  I generally do not write reviews however these are so poorly constructed they should be ashamed of themselves.  The boots had 1.5 seasons of use and the seams are failing on both boots in the same place and snow is now entering the boots.  They said they were out of warranty (1 year) so there was nothing they could do.  Also, they are also very uncomfortable with a toe cap that when you extend your toes it digs into all of your metatarsal joints and leaves a mark on my feet.  This company has been around for a long time and no longer putting out quality gear.
review.name: Garbage

name: Snowfield Touring Boot - 2025

review.reviewBody: I brought my children's warm horsies and coats just in time
review.name: I'm so Happy with every product I buy for the north face

review.reviewBody: Perfect for fall. Cute hood with ears fits around the head good so, the brisk fall air in Rochester, ny doesn't get my little. It's soft and the fold over sleeve is great for his little fingers to stay warm
review.name: Adorable and functional

review.reviewBody: I brought this for my niece just turned two. Her mom and I only buy her winter clothing in her current size because by next season there a strong possibility that it won't fit. She currently wearing 2T clothing. For this cut, I think if she was a little chubbier it wouldn't be snug on her. My niece is also in the 80% percentile for her height and the arms fit just at length. We really brought it to match her little sister who has onesie jacket in the same color, so now we got 2 cubs in the house.
review.name: Keeping my nieces matching

review.reviewBody: This might be the cutest baby hoodie ever ! Its so warm and cuddly its like wrapping him in a soft balnket.
review.name: Every Baby/ Toddler needs one !

review.reviewBody: Super cute and fits perfect on the baby. And came fast
review.name: Highly recommend

review.reviewBody: I love it for my babygirl pretty pink color fits well true to size and very warm and enough room for her to wear a sweater underneath
review.name: yes i would definitely purchase again

review.reviewBody: I love the hood. It's too cute and how amazing the sleeves are. They can help cover the hands.
review.name: Sleeves are amazing!

review.reviewBody: The fleece runs a little large, but ...... it will last her longer. It is very soft and my granddaughter looks great in it.
review.name: Love It!

review.reviewBody: My great niece and my God daughter is going to look so precious for Xmas
review.name: I purchased 2

review.reviewBody: Great for my growing toddler who does not like to wear hat and gloves yet. The gloves are attached as well as the hat so she can't take off and lose. Incredible softness. Room to adventure in this winter!! Thank you
review.name: Practical beautiful winter must

review.reviewBody: Quality is high, they are supple and the fit is good. Shipping was prompt. Give me a season-I promise I will wear them hard and cold and review again.
review.name: Kind of a stupid review, as it is July and I haven't used them yet...

review.reviewBody: I am a fan of my mits being not too thick. THese are great and keep my hands dry! great mitt
review.name: Great light weight mitts

review.reviewBody: I appreciate that these gloves are not too expensive but I struggle to see there purpose, I have waterproofed them with Nikwax for leather, but as a snowboarder the right hand glove always gets soaked through ( from strapping in and out). I have quite a few black diamond products and can’t fault the quality of any thing else, but have been left severely disappointed by the quality of these mitts
review.name: Session knit mitts

review.reviewBody: Just the right amount of insulation for touring both up on cold days and down on most days.
review.name: Just right

review.reviewBody: Great everyday mitt. Playing with kids in the snow, xc skiing or a hike with the dog. Overall loving them
review.name: Everyday mitt

review.reviewBody: Great fit. Bought these for the Black Diamond quality and didn’t disappoint. Chase leash is a must for our children.
review.name: Great Gloves

review.reviewBody: The gloves look great and feel good. The one issue is the narrowness of them. Hopefully they will stretch out.
review.name: Look great

review.reviewBody: These guys are cozy and cool looking. I think I'm going to really like them. The xl is perfect size for some glove inserts. My hand is a normal man size hand.
review.name: Session mitts

review.reviewBody: For a lighter Mitt these are very warm and comfortable
review.name: Surprisingly warm

review.reviewBody: I was pleasantly surprised how well I could manage while wearing these mittens. Zipper pulls, buckling down boots, separating skis, handling small items….all accomplished without the need to take off a mitt. Impressed with how warm they were in sub-12 degree weather; yet at 25+ degrees my hands did not get sweaty. Also appreciate the suede piece along the thumb. These mittens ticks ALL my boxes! Thanks BD for such a well-made product.
review.name: Warm, Yet Nimble

name: Session Knit Mitten

hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Kanken Gear Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I always carry this   -kånken bag-  with me, inside my bag or backpack.
I keep personal items inside.
Very comfortable.
review.name: My Kånken

review.reviewBody:
I got this case at the outlet mall, and it has a really nice color! 
It’s a really nice case and I use it as a Nintendo switch case holder. 
It holds my Nintendo switch, and the game cards plus the 
Amiibo cards. Holds smaller things very well!!
review.name: Nice pockets!

review.reviewBody: I initially bought one (black) years ago as impulse purchase when at the local FR store. Never used it for awhile and then started using it to keep my cell phone and watch chargers. It's awesome and I love the two smaller pouches and main pouch. Simple. Then I bought the spicy orange one for upcoming travel - passports, papers, boarding passes, etc Plan to keep all of these in the main compartment. Didn't want the passport bag b/c too many compartments - again keep things simple. Love the FR Mini Gear Bag! Today bought two more - Artic Green for all the things in my purse (Vardag Bag!) - lotion, eye drops, chapstick, gloss, losanges, etc. - and then my son with me at the store said he needed one as a new pencil case lol so got him the Frost Green. This Mini Gear Bag is literally so versatile and I love the simplicity!!
review.name: Legit have many of these! So many uses!

review.reviewBody: I don’t use this bag as much as I thought I would, it was an impulse buy. I love the fact it is an extra pocket for my backpack, it does match w/ everything I got. It has a lot of room & very spacious!
review.name: Very roomy

name: Kanken Gear Bag

review.itemreviewed: Echo Lace SJ BOA Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Have a couple days on them so far & break in is coming along. 
Fit is top notch. Slim through the ankle, good hold with the harness. Toe box has a little height to it (which I am a fan of). 
I will say this boot at least starts out stiff. Will see where it ends up after a few days, but would say it's not as stiff as a Malamute, but probably a second in line for stiffness. 
Added powerstrap at the top is a bonus!
review.name: All the features & great fit

name: Echo Lace SJ BOA Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Men's

review.itemreviewed: High Exposure GORE-TEX C-Knit Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I'm 6'4" and a 34" waist and bought the large. The bib itself seems great - it was lightweight and waterproof-looking shell and the pocket mapping was good. However, the straps aren't long enough! The crotch of the bib was grabbing my junk too much to be wearable. I don't understand why I would be maxing out the straps in a size large, especially since an XL would be too big around the waist. 

What's to lose by making the straps a little longer? Another couple inches would have made it a perfect fit, and anyone who doesn't need the extra length can tighten the straps. I'm really disappointed to have to return it now, it would have been perfect otherwise...
review.name: Straps aren't long enough

review.itemreviewed: High Exposure GORE-TEX C-Knit Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Perfect for long walks in the backcountry or warmer days in the resort. So lightweight. You get excellent freedom of movement. Also love the ankle cinch
review.name: Excellent Shell Bib

name: High Exposure GORE-TEX C-Knit Bib Pant - Men's
