review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These things are thick and well insulated. To the point where they almost look like ski pants on me. To be fair, I am 5'8" and 120lbs so that doesn't help. Little more than I was hoping for, but I think for working outside in the winter, these will be great.
review.name: BIG, THICK, WARM. (pause?)

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are great for cold days outdoors. Fits true to size. Lots of pockets, really warm and good ventilation, great articulation and they look good.
review.name: Great for cold weather

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality, embroidering, and love The deep fit of this hat
review.name: Grateful Dead trucker hat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] All the bells and whistles you could ask for in a pant, just didn't fit right. Too tight around the waist and thighs, and too long. Looked great on my wife so I gave them to her.
review.name: So close to amazing but not a great fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] 686 for the win. Super solid pant. Wish the cuff was adjustable.
review.name: Another Win

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these pants, have a ton of 686 pants but first pair of utility. The warmth of these are great and with the vents makes me love them cause I run hot. Will buy more for sure.
review.name: New favorite

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really cool pant. But the size is too big for me (5'6" male. fit). i do prefer a slimmer fit though. Could have made waist work, maybe tailored. but the knee placement just didnt work
review.name: Nice but too big for me

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Purchased a size large, 34 w x 32 ins, but finding the fit very snug and seem a little smaller than expected. They are further supposed to be relaxed fit, yet they seem to fit more like a slim fit.
review.name: Purchased a size large, 34

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These pants are the real deal. I've worn them 7 times in a row before first wash and they were comfortable, warm, and tough every time. I've been snow plowing and shoveling with these, doing out side shop work. Getting them dirty and abusing them. These pants hold right up to the abuse so good I already ordered another pair while I could! Definitely the best cold weather work pants I've ever bought. The fact you don't have to adjust the built in belt to pee is awesome too. Perfect design! 10/10!
review.name: Love these work pants!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome pants. Heavy duty, almost like lightweight snowboard pants. Fit is really nice.
review.name: Rugged pants FTW!

name: Utility Pant - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Maxxis Forekaster WT Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great tire that sticks when others slip
review.name: Aggressive XC Tire

review.reviewBody: I have tried these out a few times. Once with light snow on trails (<1") and frozen dirt, the tires held traction nicely.  29x2.35 mounted on 25mm inner frame. F@18PSI, R@20PSI (weight 160lbs). Second time, a bit more more snow ~5" not so good in the soft, but traction was great on the compacted snow trails from hikers and fat bikers. This time F@10PSI, R@12PSI. No issues with these low pressures in the snow; would not recommend these pressures on any other surface.
review.name: Great in snow as well

name: Forekaster WT Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire

review.reviewBody: I left a review on the tights to this top and they were a definite no. The top could be it, but the material needs a lot of work. It's stiffish, itchy feeling. Not stretchy at all. I would have to order a size up. As a true NF medium, the sleeves aren't long enough and torso barely is. Not ordering a size up because of material.

review.reviewBody: I had hoped to be wearing this crew base layer by now, but our local weather is still too warm. At least I can vouch for the quality of the fabric, the design, and the fit, all of which are excellent.
review.name: Nice addition to my winter outdoor wear.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] But the set in 2 colors and wife looks and feels great in them.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought another set of these in a different color same out come AMAZING

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sized up after reading comments that it runs small. Glad I did because it doesn't have enough stretch like a waffle knit. The color and style is great if it just had a bit more give it would get a 5.
review.name: Women's Crew

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the fabric. It trapped with your body. dry fast. Good for winter outside activity.
review.name: Good winter performance base layer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loved the fabric, which is super soft. Fits true to size.
review.name: Great undershirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable and light as base layer for skiing. Not restrictive. Long enough in torso. Good thumb holes. On a 35 degree sunny day I only wore this under my bib snow pants skiing in VT with the 3in 1jacket and was plenty warm. Black is versatile with cute designed bottom base layer.
review.name: Comfortable and warm under ski jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this crew shirt. It is so stylish. It's perfect for a morning run, or to wear with leggings, jeans, sweats a cute hat or beanie! It has a versatile look and can be worn many different ways. I'm a medium, but sized up to a large and it fits nice. Not too tight and not too loose. I bought it in black as well :)
review.name: I would buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light and good fit. I layered it under a sweater shirt on a skiing day.
review.name: Great base layer for skiing.

review.reviewBody: Very cute and functional; chose wide for high arches and they fit well; I have a tiny bit of pinching on my arch if I wear them all day with thick socks; obviously the low height may not prevent all water incoming but so far I've been wearing them everywhere and for everything and I've been super satisfied.
review.name: Stylish lil rainboots

review.reviewBody: Boots feel very sturdy, are comfortable, and yes totally waterproof! They are thicker than my last pair of bogs, which I appreciate. Green color is also very fun and matches everything in my wardrobe. I think they fit a bit smaller than my last pair, which I also appreciate as a barely fits a 6 foot size! Maybe size up if you are in between sizes though.
review.name: Comfy, perfect!

review.reviewBody: Wonderful comfort and sustains in all kinds of weather-
review.name: just right!

review.reviewBody: I bought these boots because I needed some cuter rain boots in Ireland/England and these fit all of my requirements. I wore these boots almost every day of the two weeks I was in Europe and they held up so well! They kept my feet dry and were so comfortable, I didn't mind wearing them all the time. I had a severe ankle injury last year (involved surgery) and these made me feel so stable, even on all of those lovely cobblestone streets, and my ankle didn't bother me. I will recommend wearing them before taking them on a big trip; they do some rubbing around the ankles where I wasn't used to having shoes that height. I would highly recommend these boots!!
review.name: Walked All Over Europe

review.reviewBody: So comfortable! Love them so much!! I got 7 wide. I am typically size 7.5 or 8 in regular shoes but Bogs 7 wide is roomy and comfortable for long walks with my dogs! Super cute too!
review.name: Highly recommended!

review.reviewBody: I really love my Chelsea boots! They are easy to slip on and off, and it is comfortable to walk in. I typically had to buy separate shoe inserts for all of my other rain boots, but I did not did one for these! I walk our dogs a lot on our 4-acre property, and these are so comfortable for long walks.
review.name: High recommended!

review.reviewBody: Love the style! Have not worn yet because it is summertime but I know they will be perfect for fall/winter and travel!
review.name: Love the style

review.reviewBody: These boots only made it 4 months for me before the sole started separating from the boot. I love the color so I am so disappointed that I have to find another more reliable and durable boot.
review.name: Love the color and sleek look, but they didn't last long

review.reviewBody: Great for use in rain, snow, and mud. Hose off and look like new!
review.name: Comfy, stylish, and very versatile

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately not a good fit for me. Otherwise, liked the look and style.
review.name: Unfortunately not styled for my foot.

name: Sweetpea II Chelsea Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very light and confortable, size up. Good for long redes. I usualy buy Large in other brands and XL in Castellis.
review.name: Very confortable.

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: In the same size, the Aero RC fits smaller than a pair of Espresso bibs.  The pad is nice and located well.  The material used in the lower is comfortable and the legs do stay down without silicone gripper.  The bib straps are just bad though.  They aren't at all soft so are prone to raw nips.  The also aren't very stretchy and are cut short for the size.  So much tighter than the straps of the Espresso bibs of the same size.  And there is an uncomfortable seam in the yoke that is itchy & scratchy on the upper back.
review.name: Runs small, bib straps are uncomfortable

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: it’s very good choice for the price I bought them, regular price its a little high but the quality it’s really good and the chamois are the most comfortable that I have for a long ride
review.name: Great bibs

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I wear size small in Castelli not counting jackets I intentionally bought in medium for additional space to layer. Rosso Corsa series included.

Depending on the Castelli piece, their fitting descriptions generally makes sense for me. A "race" fit is exactly that, compressive and aero. "Tailored" similarly delivers - not as racy, still nothing flapping, but not as aggressive a fit as "race". Their "regular" for my deep winter bib tights deliver on that idea.

This Aero Race series though...

It doesn't help that the materials aren't particularly stretchy. It's very tight but I can tolerate them once they're on, but getting in is tough. This is made worse by possibly weak seam stitching compared to other lines; the very first time I carefully put them on I heard a "pop" of stitching letting go.

I gave it a chance (which I regret) to break in as Castelli's new Espresso and some others for sure break in a little bit. But after several uses it's still very tight even for "race day" kit I intended it to be, well beyond "compressive". I've got stitching letting go and there's really no break in.

For comparison I have a Climber's jersey purchased at the same time in small. It's supposed to be the same race cut and fit, and it's perfect, while the Aero jersey is just too tight. It fit out of the bag, broke in ever so slightly - and it's perfect.

Sadly I'm just beyond 30 days for returns (I asked and understandably was refused other than a 15% discount) so this is mostly just a very tight and expensive disappointment.

Bottomline is size up (even MORE, even if you don't normally) and don't assume there will be any break in. If it's too tight when you try them on for the first time they'll likely stay that way. This applies to the jersey too.
review.name: Weird sizing, even more than normal

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
5'8" at 161 lbs.  Bought size L.
This is great snug fit without struggling to get it on. Super happy with the chamois and raw-cut design above the knees works well. Does not ride up at all.
My favorite bib during the season.
review.name: Great bib

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: A few years ago I did a comparison between Assos and Castelli bibs and found the Castelli chamois to be vastly superior. The Assos chamois was thicker, but not nearly dense enough. I can ride much further more comfortably in a Castelli chamois. I do sometimes hear size complaints, anything from Castelli should be ordered at least 2 sizes up from normal in my experience, but once you have that figured out, they are a real winner. Very comfortable!
review.name: Love these bibs, especially the chamois

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
All my bibs have been Assos until I got a Castelli Sanremo speed suit. Wanting to ride the same chamois during both training and race day, I bought some Free Aero RC bibs. I've been riding Assos Equipe bibs for 5 years so they are my benchmark. 

This is a size M to M comparison of the Free Aero RC and Assos Equipe RS S9 Targa bibs.

FIT
Hands down, the Castelli has more compression. They call it a "race fit"; you could call it a smaller fit as well. It takes a few attempts to pull the material at my hips to get it the rest of the way on so it disappears. Assos fits like a second skin and immediately disappears. Pull it on and go. Back to back, though, Assos feels loose, and I have to tug the legs down after an hour or two.
WINNER: Assos

CHAMOIS
The floating chamois of the Assos is thick, comfy, and invisible. For whatever reason, this floating design recently no longer "sits" well with me. Turns out, if I pull the Assos on too high it bunches the chamois on either side of my family jewels. Castelli is the opposite: I have to pull it way high or it will feel saggy. Castelli fixes the Progretto chamois in place so it never moves. It is also thinner where you don't sit and thicker at the sit bones. The lumpy feeling does eventually disappear... The chamois feels lower tech honestly.
WINNER: Tie

THE CROTCH
People have given Assos flack for their cod piece design. I can't blame them, it looks hideous! Boy is it comfortable though! They toned it down with the S9 Targa but it is still glorious. Castelli doesn't leave any room in the crotch; they even put a seam that you have to arrange around or you will a hotspot where you definitely don't want it. With rearranging, the Castelli is fine. Not great, but fine. It took a month, post-vasectomy, before my Castelli bibs were OK again. Been riding Assos exclusively while I've healed because the space difference is profound.
WINNER: Assos by a long shot

MATERIALS AND CONSTRUCTION
Assos feels luxurious. The straps are smooth and the stiches are immaculate and perfectly placed. Castelli is rough around the edges (literally, the straps are terrible except the small spot they want your shoulders to be). Castelli's seams come with thread sticking out and will start to come apart in places that rub and places that don't.
WINNER: Assos

BREATHABILITY
Assos breaths better in the crotch and maybe the chamois; Castelli at the straps. The rest of the materials are similar enough. I'll ride either of them in the Texas summer.
WINNER: Assos by a hair

AFFORDABILITY
At retail, Assos is $40 more than Castelli. Castelli goes on sale regularly at 15-30% off. In the long run, Assos might last longer but I don't mind stitching a seam or two to save nearly $100.
WINNER: Castelli

OVERALL
I bought a handful of the Castelli bibs.
review.name: Decent until the stiches come undone

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I should have known better than to try and switch things up.  I have multiple pair of Giordana FR-C Pro, and Pearl Izumi Pro bibs.  Several years ago I had tried Castelli and liked the chamois - so I decided to pull the trigger.  The chamois itself is super dense and seems like it would be fantastic…but I simply will not be able to find out.  Straight out of the bag the first pair I ordered wasn’t sewn together properly.  The bib strap was only sewn into the shorts on one side!  

The Competitive Cyclist team were awesome (as always) and issued me a replacement immediately.  The second pair arrived, and after ONE RIDE they are already coming apart.  The fabric at the leg opening is starting to fray and I’m worried will end up resulting in longer tear, and the stitching around the outside of the chamois is literally pulling apart.  The quality control at Castelli is just not acceptable, so please do not waste your money on this kit!  

All I can say is thank goodness for the awesome customer service at CC - even on the odd occasion when I get a dud product, I’m never worried about buying it from CC because they actually care about their customers.  Five stars for Competitive Cyclist, but I would give zero for these bibs if I could.
review.name: Save Your Money

name: Free Aero RC Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: Nice boots. Currently wearing them in Northern Norway (Arctic Circle) and they are comfortable and warm.  Sizing is spot on, but if you plan on wearing thicker socks you may want to size up 1/2 size.
review.name: Surviving the Arctic Circle

review.reviewBody: Bought at short notice before Lapland trip. Arrived within 24 hours to Ireland. Ordered half a size up, wore on plane and in deep snow in -15 temperatures. Feet stayed warm and dry throughout.
review.name: Fantastic Cold Weather Boot

review.reviewBody: Really do love the shoe/boot. There is a small inconvenience on my shin where you tie the boot. it is not perfectly flat so if I tighten them, they hurt, but a little looser and they are just fine.
review.name: Close to Perfect!

review.reviewBody: I got a recommendation from my Montana nephew because there are SO many snow boots on the market now. . He has a pair, said they were pricy but extremely worth it. They looked narrow so I got 1 size larger. I put them on when I received them. And walked around the rest of the day. They were warm and extremely comfortable.  I got the right height as I was concerned they'd knock me over like my old ones. I simlly LOVE them. I have other odd boots, there going to Goodwill. I highly recommend these boots .
review.name: My amazing boots

name: Scout 87 Lux Waterproof Boot - Men's

review.name: My go-to underwear

review.itemreviewed: Give-N-Go Sport 2.0 Bikini Brief Underwear - Women's
review.reviewBody: So comfortable and breathable! Very happy with product.
review.name: So comfy!

review.itemreviewed: Give-N-Go Sport 2.0 Bikini Brief Underwear - Women's
review.reviewBody: I don't like that the front end of the crotch piece is not sewn down. Also the fabric is soft but flimsy compared to my old versions.
review.name: Construction is not as good
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our Women's Give-N-Go® 2.0 Sport Mesh Bikini Brief product. We truly appreciate you bringing the design matter to our attention.
I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.
 
At ExOfficio, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using ExOfficio products in the future.
 
We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.exofficio.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
ExOfficio Consumer Care

review.itemreviewed: Give-N-Go Sport 2.0 Bikini Brief Underwear - Women's
review.reviewBody: Runs small, mostly due to the elastic. The waistband and leg elastic are VERY tight/strong, and the leg holes are small, especially if you have an athletic build. I am unable to wear these for a full day due to the squeezing discomfort. The tightness level of the elastic doesn't match the fabric stretch and size(which feels true to size). Sizing up to fit the elastic would result in baggy fabric. I will not purchase these again; there are many other options for breathable/wicking/quick-dry underwear these days, at much lower price points.
review.name: Very tight elastic
comment:

review.itemreviewed: Give-N-Go Sport 2.0 Bikini Brief Underwear - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these underwear. They fit great. When we recently traveled to Europe, I would wash them in the evening in the sink and they would be mostly dry the next morning when I hung them to dry on a towel rack or over the tub edge. Only complaint I would have is if I was wearing Athleta type pants and it was a warm day, they don’t absorb sweat the same way my regular cotton underwear would.
review.name: Great for travel!

review.itemreviewed: Give-N-Go Sport 2.0 Bikini Brief Underwear - Women's
review.reviewBody: Light, wicking, all-day comfort — outdoor for sure, am going to try indoor wear!
review.name: A trekking must have.

review.itemreviewed: Give-N-Go Sport 2.0 Bikini Brief Underwear - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love, love, love these bikini briefs! They don't stretch out, they fit like advertised, no lines, light weight, perfect for travel!!
review.name: Buy these briefs!

name: Give-N-Go Sport 2.0 Bikini Brief Underwear - Women's

review.reviewBody: I recently washed out on some gravel and slid 15 feet at around 20mph. Road rash on my arm but my hands were totally fine. I ripped a hole in the palm of one of the gloves but no scrapes and not even a bruise on my hand. Too many of these gloves have padding in stupid places. This has all the right padding in all the right places. These saved me a ton of pain so I’m getting another pair for sure. Totally recommend these if you like to ride hard and get at it
review.name: Padded Palms!

review.reviewBody: 3 short rides with these and they are starting to rip at a seam. You would think for the price they would hold up better.
review.name: Fox Dirt Paw’s

review.reviewBody: Just bought another pair of these Fox Paws and they probably won't be the last. I find them to be the perfect balance of protection versus tactile feel. Easy entry, ample velcro on closure strap and hey they look great. Sizes run true, GYSOT
review.name: Again and again

review.reviewBody: I ordered blue and got red but hey I’m not complaining I would love some blue ones though
review.name: Very comfortable but I want my blue ones

review.reviewBody: These gloves are billet proof! I’ve used them for years on my motorcycles. And they fit the bill for E mountain biking as well. Fix is perfect as long as you follow the chart. And style and price where right on mark too! If you like the looks but then you won’t regret it.
review.name: Fox dirt paw gloves

review.reviewBody: First pair of riding gloves they only lasted a year and a quarter at most. Holes began to come around a year at the top finger tips and along the side. And the palm became thinner  by a year mark too. Just left Fox brand completely
review.name: Poor Quality

review.reviewBody: These are great gloves. Last a long time, good comfort. Will buy again
review.name: Love em

review.reviewBody: I bought these a month ago and they looked and felt good when I put them on. The padding in the palm area that rides against the handlebars when you ride had me hopeful but the added thickness made me pump up much faster, probably just me. The part that bothered me the most is the second time I put them on the wristband almost ripped off the glove.
review.name: Wristband ripped 2nd time I put them on

review.reviewBody: Gloves fit perfect. Kept my hands warm during a 80 mile round trip in 42 degree weather.
review.name: Great glove and excellent fit

review.reviewBody: One of yhe best gloves i ever had i love buying stuff from you guys i always get my stuff on time
review.name: Great product

name: Dirtpaw Glove - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought this hiking boot one month ago. I've been one difficult and one moderate hike. Both trails were wet. The Vasque Waterproof Torre AT GTX Boot performed excellent. Traction grip was awesome, boot was light and comfortable with no links. This boot is ready for action and the midnight blue color looks fantastic. Can't wait to hit the trails 
again.
review.name: Vasque Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot

review.itemreviewed: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I use these boots in the Davis Mountains of west Texas.  Lots of loose, sharp rock and bushes with long thorns.  The soles are stiff enough to protect your feet during a long hike and give good traction.      No thorns have penetrated yet.  Lightweight.
review.name: Lightweight and comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Nope   def not for me.
IF you  have  feet that at super thin and calfs that are  robust an can handle weights and cosntant  pressure,  and  thin/slippery  sox these might be good.

if not........... they are  a pain to  put on , almost impossible to get off without slamming ur other foot on the back of them  whcih always does  wonder  for bootslongevity,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,!~)
the tongue  as mentioned is cumbersome and  the  lacing system  is **appaling**
what a waste of money~!!

im stuck with them ,so i will try and stretch them  out.
thin , heavy . plodders  
sooooo peeeved.

a present for my 25 kilo ballerina  friend   with runbing back calfs are in thier future.........................
review.name: PIXIE feet  width with tunder calfs..

review.itemreviewed: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these on a whim from the outdoor store in Leadville CO 1 day prior to a planned hike up Mt Elbert. I had planned on using my Vasque Sundowners despite those boots being about 1/2 size too small (size 11.5). My buddy did not have adequate footwear for the trail conditions and wears size 11.5 so I gave him the sundowners to wear and I bought these.

They were great right out of the box!  Normally I would not do a brand new boot for a hike like that but didn’t really have a choice. I had no issues with foot pain or blisters. However, my buddy developed a huge heel blister with the Sundowners. I ended up switching boots with him about 4-5 miles in and he was able to make it to the Summit and back with no further issues. I finished out the day in the sundowners without any issues but the Torres definitely felt better. Could be a size thing but if you are on the fence between Sundowners and Torres for any reason, I’d go with Torre. They are light and comfortable and the vibram outsole provides great traction.
review.name: Super awesome hiking boots
comment: Thank you for your comments and suggestions. We hope to continue serving you in the future!

review.itemreviewed: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very pleased with hiking boots purchased at Red Wing in Mississauga!   Went looking for fishing rod dropped overboard in Lake Koocanusa last summer.  In the Fall the water drains back in the reservoir.  Hiked in from the Elk River and went through several small streams and rocky patches to the approximate location.  Was about to give up when I saw some deer tracks and some bear tracks.  Started looking at the bear  tracks and low and behold the bear stepped right on the rod buried in the mud.  Should have taken a pictures of it with bear paw print but was too excited to have found the rod.   Went to clean the rod in the river. Boots kept my feet dry but the jeans were wet for a bit.  All cleaned up nice when I got home.  Next time out hiking, I will remember to bring bear spray.
review.name: Really Great
comment: We are so happy that your boots are performing well and that the bear didn't get you. Thanks for leaving us a great review!

review.itemreviewed: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to like these boots. They're everything I was looking for in a backpacking boot: leather upper, Gore-Tex, full one-piece rand, amply cushioned midsole, Vibram outsole, light weight, solid construction, and awesome styling. What killed it for me is the tongue, collar, and placement of the lacing hooks. The tongue is not very wide or well cushioned, and there is a stiff seam that lands right on the inside/front of the ankle bone (medial malleolus). The lacing hooks are spaced too close to the front of the collar, and are too close together when laced, which forces the tongue inward and causes more pressure on that bone. Unfortunately, the boots were too painful when properly laced, and I had to return them.

Vasque: widen the tongue and add more padding, place the 2nd set of lacing hooks further back, and the 3rd set of lacing hooks even further back, and you might have a winning boot.
review.name: Painful tongue and lacing hooks
comment: We appreciate you taking the time to give us this review. I'm sorry to hear these didn't work out the greatest for you. I will pass your opinions on to the proper channels for future improvements!

review.itemreviewed: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great all around boots. No break-in time needed. Right mix of comfort and support.
review.name: Vasque Torre AT

name: Torre AT GTX Hiking Boot - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Crank Brothers Gen 1 Stamp 1 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Got these on sale and thought the reviews had to be overblown... WRONG! Didn't even take these out of my driveway they are so slippery.
review.name: Terrible!

review.reviewBody: I have owned many a pair of Crank Brother pedals through the years and never had a single complaint about how my foot made contact with and stuck to the pedal. These pedals on the other hand changed that. I read the reviews after my purchase and figured I would at least put them on my bike  and check them out since they were on the way. Well, all of the negative reviews are true and after taking 1 look at the design from the side it is obvious why they are worthless. The middle bar sits way too high making it impossible for the pegs to contact your shoe. I put them on my bike for a test ride down the driveway and verified they do not work well after a quick roll off the pedal. The price is great but the pedals are not. If you read this and other reviews on this thread take them seriously and don't purchase these. Save yourself the loss of a few bucks in return shipping and possibly a broken ankle. Very disappointed Crank Bros
review.name: 1 star reviews are true

review.reviewBody: superlight and big enough for my shoes size, the only complain is pedals should  include bigger pins
review.name: great pedals

review.reviewBody: There is no other way to put this: these pedals are awful. I have never felt less securely attached to my bike than when I'm standing on these pedals, and that's a fact. I thought I was taking crazy pills, but these darn things are seriously malformed. My feet pretty much don't contact the pegs on the front & back of the pedal because the center line is so high. It's back asswards! What everyone else says about them in the reviews is completely true. I have no idea how Crank Brothers got this wrong. All their other stuff is great! I won't stop buying their stuff because of this, but still - holy cow&
review.name: Fail.

review.reviewBody: These pedals are convexed rather than concaved. The axle area in the center of the pedal is TALLER than the rest of the pedal. Not flat, not concaved. Zero grip, your foot would want to slip off of it. Pedals look great from a distance. Would be a down grade from the most stock pedals. They look strong and solid. I hope they fix this, it would be a great pedal.
review.name: TERRIBLE!! Let down, they look great.

review.reviewBody:
I don't know what kind of shoes Crankbros used to test this but even using it for riding around town ended in pedal slips. The worst MTB product I have used by far, and it's surprising cause Crankbros usually make great stuff. 

Avoid at all costs
review.name: I don't understand how this released

review.reviewBody: My mistake as I didn?t read the reviews like I should. Great affordable pedal but the ridge down the center made me never feel like my feet were secure. Slipped pedals in dry, wet, cold, warm, any condition, just couldn?t keep my feet on the pedal. The solution, instead of making them slim, beef up the exterior so they have a convex layout that your feet/shoes sit into. I will be replacing them.
review.name: Middle rise makes them unusable

review.reviewBody:
I've had these on my Santa Cruz Bronson now for about 6 months. They are for sure a budget option coming in at around the lowest price point for flat pedals out there ($50). However they have held up pretty well for me. I don't pedal strike too often as there aren't a ton of rocks on the trails in southern California. However the few times I have struck one, they don't give that feeling of resonating through your entire skeleton as the alloy pedals often do. 

One of my favorite things about the CB design is that there are 2 pins near the center of the pedal. I find that if you land a jump with the heel of your foot back a bit that these 2 pins can be that difference of the extra grab needed to forgive the slight misplacement of the shoe on the pedal and keep you from slamming your shin. 

I'm sure the composite won't hold up for as long as their metal counterparts but riding wise I don't notice a pedal feel difference between plastic and the metal pedals I've ridden. 

Grip wise I actually had to adjust the pins all the way in to their max height and that helped with the convex shape of the pedal itself. I find the grip to work well paired with a grippy fiveten shoe. I've sent some big stuff and had no issues with slipping on these where I have on other brands. I was going to upgrade to the stamp 7 for my other bike but actually ended up going with these again as the price is on point for what you get. Even the higher end CB pedals use the same internals so I didn't see the need to spend 3x the money. 

Also I'm a size 9.5 shoe and use the Large size platform. I've tried the small as well but the large is more stable feeling. The small is better for those tight trail sections tough for sure.
review.name: Budget option that doesn't lack

name: Gen 1 Stamp 1 Pedals

review.itemreviewed: Wasatch Pro 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic - Kids'
review.reviewBody:
This North Face Wasatch Pro kids sleeping bag is a winner. I've been using North Face bags since the time when they were still owned by Douglas Tompkins. The sleeping bags never faileth. I have two of the Kazoo series and my wife has one. They work perfect for us. So I assumed that a big old bulky, synthetic kids bag at 20°F would be perfect for my 3.5 y/o little lady while camping in 45°F weather near Capitol Reef.

She has always seen mom and dad camping in sleeping bags. She was thrilled when she saw her favorite stuffed animal sleeping in it on the living room floor after dinner one night. She jumped right in. The colors are kid perfect.

The bag is pretty cozy. But I did need to put one of her blankies in with her, just for that extra warmth. Since she is still small, I stuffed another blanket in the bottom just past her feet so the mass of dead air down there wouldn't get cold. 

Not sure I would take a kid camping in colder weather. If that was the case, I would probably need a warmer bag. But I think that is true for most of us with the sleeping bag ratings. 20°F bags generally mean you'll survive a 20°F night, but be pretty comfy at 40°F.
review.name: Crazy First Sleeping Bag Review

name: Wasatch Pro 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic - Kids'

review.reviewBody: Been running in Brooks for about 12 years now. Without exception, the best shoe for cross country! Hope to use these many times in my future. Just wish they had a wide size.
review.name: Stability on rough terrain

review.reviewBody: Best shoe Brooks makes in my personal opinion my choice of all brooks shoes
review.name: Nice shoe

review.reviewBody: I like the overall design of the shoe.  Comfortable and not too wide.  The laces stay put.  It's a little too narrow on the toe box heightwise. But I hope I'll loosen up with time.  It feels a little heavy, but at 65, I need the extra cushion.  Grip is great on dry or wet grass.  I'm having a little pain on my right foot's outer side, but hopefully it'll go away once broken in.  The Caldera 6 felt softer and more cushioned, but the 7 has better toe guard, so may last longer.  Overall, it's great.
review.name: Caldera 7

review.reviewBody: I am very satisfied with the performance of the Caldera 7 for trail running even during December in New England.
review.name: Great on the Trail

review.reviewBody: Comfortable BUT ran short, i wear a size 10.5 and my front toes were hitting the front end pretty hard, couldn't see myself wearing a larger shoe size. It didn't give me a chance to review any other topics to help others.
review.name: Short run

review.reviewBody: I was a huge fan of the Caldera 5, and the 6's redesign was not good for me.  The 6s felt a lot like Hokas (and I cannot run in Hokas).  The 7 is better than the 6 because they feel less clunky in the heel.  However, there's something a little off about the 7's heel area as well.  On uneven terrain, it feels like my foot wants to roll in at the heel, which is somewhat off-putting.  But it'll do for now; hoping the 8s are more like the 5s.
review.name: Better than the 6; looking forward to the 8.

review.reviewBody: most uncomfortable shoes l ever put on my feet. had a friend try them on and she felt the same way. the foot bed feels weird!
review.name: uncomfortable

review.reviewBody:
The overall quality & fit was even better than I had expected.  I really wish I had bought two pairs at the same time.  Now your're out of stock in my size .... rats!! (I know, snooze/lose)   
Great fit and comfy.  A good bite on the trail while in action.

I just love these , I got the men’s version because I wanted a wider shoe and I bought 1/2 size larger , they fit perfectly and I love the yellow ! People look at my shoes instead of me 😆, which suits me fine !
I love these !
review.name: Great shoes!

review.reviewBody: Very happy with Caldera. I have 2 pair of Caldera 6 and 1 pair of Caldera 7.

name: Caldera 7 Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
This is marketed as close-to-skin fit but it’s baggy. I decided to try this instead of my favorite race top, which has a true close-to-skin fit. I’ll be returning this since it’s too loose and there’s too much extra fabric on the front and back body. While I didn’t try riding in this, I suspect the fabric on the shoulders will flap because it puckers too much.

I haven’t had trouble with colors on Backcountry being misrepresented on my computer but this is dark raspberry, not the more vibrant pink in the photo.

I do like the color, slim zipper, type of fabric used for the sleeves and comfortable neckline. It’s a nice top if you’re not looking for a skin tight fit.
review.name: Not close-to-skin fit

name: NX-G Air Short-Sleeve Jersey - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Straight Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Unfortunately, I’m disappointed to report that the waist button fell off after less than ten wears. While the fabric is excellent, the button’s durability is absolutely terrible.
review.name: Not durable

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Straight Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've purchased several versions of these pants over the years and like the new cut and fit of the slim straight pattern. Unfortunately while wearing the button on the waist just fell off, and the rivet as well. I've worn them less than 10 times.  I've read reviews complaining about the same issue and some friends who wear Prana say they experienced the same when I mentioned what happened to mine. 
It's too bad, but I won't be purchasing these again in the future.
review.name: Great fabric and fit, poor quality

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Straight Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have loved my original Stretch Zion pants. I've worn them religiously for years, and as a matter of fact I'm wearing a pair right now, even though they're quite old. 

And the "version II" pants came out, and I nearly swore off buying anything from Prana. Clearly those were not cut from the same cloth, no pun intended. 

Then I saw that original fabrics were coming back, and I also saw that they were gonna offer a straight leg version of the pants in those fabrics. Count me in, I said, and so I placed an order through Backcountry. 

The pants arrived -- and while the fabric was better than the version II crap, it still wasn't quite the same. The sizing had changed as well, for though I had entered the exact same sizes I've worn for years (and am wearing right now) none of the pants fit well. Way too loose around the waist, even when I used the handy take-up strap. In case there was a discrepancy between each pair, I chose to try on each of the three pairs of straight leg pants I'd ordered...

...and while trying the last pair on, the front of the waist button sheared off and fell to the floor. Prior to that, I'd been thinking I would just exchange the pants for ones sized more appropriately. But Prana quality control is beyond sizing problems, it seems. I packaged up the pants along with the broken piece of button, and thanks to Backcountry's return policy I was soon refunded my money. [Thanks, y'all.]

It's truly a shame to see how Prana just doesn't make durable, properly fitted stuff any more. If your fortunes with this new gear have been different than mine, then good for you, but it looks as though other manufacturers will be getting my money and support.
review.name: Fabric different; sizing changed too

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Straight Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
TLDR - If you're a fan of the OG Zions and want a straighter leg fit, just buy them. 


I was thrilled to see Prana go back to the original stretch Zion fabric after only offering the version II using that crappy re-zion fabric. I've worn Brions and Stretch Zions since 2016. I have probably gone through more than a dozen pairs because I lost a significant amount of weight over the years. 

I loved the OG Zions. These ones are even better. They are more form fitting, especially in the upper and lower leg. There's no billowing out around my ankles. I like the rubber coated zippers. 

Love the feel and fit so much I bought 3 pairs as soon as I could find them in my size.

The colors are OK. The green is sort of a muted khaki tan/green, the "black" is more like a navy blue/dark gray which I actually like a lot. The sepia is a little more brown than the images online, which is fine for me. I wouldn't mind having a true black or true navy, but these will do for me. 

Regarding fit, I have the most recent OG Brions and Strech Zions from about 2 years ago. Both are 30/30 and fit me perfectly. 

With these new Zions, I tried 30/30 and they were too tight in the waist and too big on my ankles (floods). I returned them for 31/32s which fit fine. Actually 31/31 would be ideal, but alas, it's not an option. 

I recommend sizing up like a did for the best fit. 

I'm 5'8" and weigh 140 lbs. I'm lean with little bit of a lower belly (what can I say, I'm over 55 and once weighed over 200 lbs so I have no delusions of ever having a 6 pack). 

As for backcountry, I'm glad to have discovered them. I'd rather buy from them than Amazon and their shipping/price is as good or better than prana directly. 

-----
The pants had two problems that I fixed myself with a seam ripper.

1) The first belt loop on the right is double stitched, which means a standard 1.5" belt has to be jammed thru to fit. All my belts are Arcade 1.5" so I used a seam ripper to remove the top stitch. On my first pair, Suspected this was a manufacturing  defect but it is apparently deliberate.  

2) Two pairs were really hard to button/unbutton because the button hole was just a bit too small. I opened it a few millimeters with my seam ripper and now they work as intended. 

Attached is my crappy bathroom selfie with the gray/blue pants and a true black shirt so you can see the difference.
review.name: OG Stretch Zion pants are the bomb!

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Straight Pant - Men's
Stretch Zion Slim Straight Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: So excited prAna brought back the original fabric in these pants. Same original fit, and finish as the original that I know and love.
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Straight Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These are some of the best pants out there. I own multiple pairs because they are comfortable, come in great colors, and my wife loves the fit on me. 

What is the down side?
review.name: Great Pants, One of the only pants I own

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Straight Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am happy to see Backcountry has this back on this site. I love the Zion.. these are durable pants and have been great for hiking and climbing.
review.name: OG IS BACK!!!

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Straight Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: The original Zion has always been my favorite pant for hiking and climbing.  I am psyched that prAna brought them back.  The straight version withe the slimmer legs fits me perfectly.
review.name: The best

name: Stretch Zion Slim Straight Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought an O'neill Epic 15 years ago and used it for almost 10 years. I bought one for.my daughter and she has been using it for years now.  It was the best wetsuit ever. Bought this new 2019 Epic last year and the seams started coming apart right away. I sent it to the O'neill factory twice under warranty and the seams are still falling apart where it was fixed and new places. Everytime I use it, I find a new hole. It's a 4/3 and I get cold in it when the water is 60 degrees. I used to be an O'neill fan, but no more, this is last one. Too bad. Please O'Neil, get it together.
review.name: Comes apart at the seams :-(

review.reviewBody: Perfect addition to the shower system. Great fit and perfect to ad to my rack to keep the hot water heater secure. Robust and well made.
Looks good and mounts easily. Wish they had more predrilled holes. Other than that no complaints

Love the product. I have had the Joolca setup for a while and decided buy the mounting bracket to attach the hottap to my exterior window panel a my 4Runner. Easy to install. Looks awesome! Works just as awesome. It’s mounted next to my shower awning attached to roof rack. I live in Arizona with some of the dustiest trails around. review.reviewBody: Highly recommend! It's compact, with many compartments, and can carry all of my essentials!
review.name: Highly recommend

review.reviewBody: I have a mini Kanken which I carry everywhere but needed something smaller to take in to doctor appointments or a quick run to the grocery store. I saw this bag in a local shop and grabbed it. I love how sturdy my Kanken bag is so I knew this one would be a solid choice. Pros: it's a sturdy, high quality bag and I love the Dusk color. It has a lot of pockets and the strap is adjustable. The only 'con' I can think of is you can't fit too much in it. There is no way a small tablet is going in this bag and I believe that's because the material is stiff. I can get my cellphone, slim profile wallet, chapstick, pen, keys and small notepad and my glasses in it. That's it. I think my issue is not that it's doesn't fit much but that it's very stiff. Hopefully it will get more pliable with use.
review.name: Fjallraven has done it again! :-)

review.reviewBody: I use this bag to keep my phone, tickets, passport and wallet right in front of me at all times while traveling. It makes it super easy to stash away in a larger bag when not needed, but then have all the important things together when the time comes.
review.name: Great for travel

review.reviewBody: I've had this bag for over 2 years and have gotten so much use out of it.   It's always my go to when I need a light crossbody purse.   Great pockets inside and out.   I have gotten a few compliments when using it.
review.name: Great little bag !

review.reviewBody: Bruger den dagligt - min iPad Mini 6 gen glider direkte ned sammen med Pencil 2 gen - og der er stadig plads til iPhone
review.name: Super kvalitet

review.reviewBody: I’m enjoying using this little bag as a Crossbody bag for my wallet and transit tickets.
review.name: Great for every day use

review.reviewBody: I have this size and the smaller size and this one fits enough of my stuff and still sits flat on my hip. Plenty of room and the colors are great!
review.name: Great option for crossbody with a bit more room than smaller version

review.reviewBody: Perfect size. Stylish and durable. Exactly what I wanted! I'll have this purse for years to come.
review.name: Love this bag!

review.reviewBody:
I've been using this bag for a few months now. I love the understated shape, and the Storm color looks nice and goes with everything. As someone who's used to leather bags, I love how lightweight this one is. It has enough pockets to keep my keys from scratching my phone etc, which I appreciate. It's the perfect size to hold phone/keys/wallet/earbuds and a few other everyday essentials. I can even fit my sunglasses case or Kindle in there. 

I wish the snap was magnetized to make it easier to close. Since it's not, I end up leaving it open and just using the zipper most of the time, which is fine but doesn't look great. My biggest complaint, though, is the vertical format makes it difficult to take advantage of all the space. I basically have to take everything out to squeeze my hand in to retrieve something from the bottom of the purse, which is annoying. If the purse were the same size and shape, but horizontal instead of vertical, I think it would be perfect.
review.name: Cute and nicely sized

review.reviewBody:
So I sometimes hate carrying my purse with me or even my Kånken when I’m just running into the store or going to dinner. And I don’t really feel like just carrying my wallet, don’t need to be losing that thing. 

So this is perfect for a quick run in or even walking my dog, and perfect for traveling. 
I bought the forest camo and I absolutely love it!
review.name: Pocket perfect

name: Greenland Pocket Shoulder Bag - Women's

review.reviewBody: Loved the 5, my first Altra shoes.  These 6s are just as great, perhaps less breezy and they don’t let in the rain.  Lovely new color, the beige, and they are true to size unlike previous models in which I’d order a half size up.  Comfy out of the box; I walked ten miles a day in them.   Tread isn’t coming unglued in this version!
review.name: Don’t size up anymore

review.reviewBody: I've had 3 prs of Olympus. Version 4 was great, Version 5 was heavy, stiff and let in all the dirt, Version 6 has fixed all that..thanks ALTRA
review.name: Love the new Olympus 6

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing the Olympus 6 trail hikers for the last week. I have noticeable pronation and my knee has started to hurt. I've worn the Olympus 5s for the last 3 years, hiking 500 mile, multi-day trails and also wear my Olympus 5s for everyday walking. The Olympus 5s are amazing, the best shoes I've ever had. The Olympus 6s are a poor substitute, the support is definitely less causing me to pronate more which is impacting my alignment and causing knee pain. I'm off to buy up any Olympus 5s that may be left.
review.name: Not as good as the Olympus 5s

review.reviewBody: I have worn the Olympus for the past five years. This is the best version so far. I had issues with the Olympus 5 and the tread coming unglued, but Altra has fixed that with the 6. I just wore these for the High Lonesome 100 for fifty miles, and they were awesome. The Olympus continues to be my favorite shoe!
review.name: Awesome shoe!

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes! I had two pairs of the 5s. The rubber did come off on the bottom the first week but I superglued it back on. I hiked the Tour du Mont Blanc in these babies and they did great! Love the extra cushioning and durability. Will definitely buy them again for my next long hike. The extra cushioning prevented any foot pain. I'd say they lasted a whole summer of maybe 200 miles of hiking!
review.name: Love the Olympus! Great for long distance hikes.

review.reviewBody: I have purchased a new pair every year. In these shoes I wear a 9.5 . In the lone peaks I wear a 9. The material is not very breathable. My feet feel hot during hiking. In previous Olympus they were more breathable. The footbed is comfortable and highly supportive. The outsole is well balanced and grippy. I never get blisters or hot spots in these shoes
review.name: This is my go to hiking shoe

review.reviewBody: The Olympus 6 is so comfortable and actually feels like a true Altra wide toebox shoe. I've been wearing them everyday since I got them 2 weeks ago and I haven't had any issues. Plus the colors are great! The pictures don't do justice. Best Olympus yet.
review.name: My new favorite shoe!

review.reviewBody: I trained for the Leadville 50 mile in the Olympus 5 and switched to the 6 the week of my race. While these fixed all the hot spots my feet were getting, these felt a little stiffer in the toe box. I felt my foot have to work a bit harder to run in these. For the walking portions of my run they were just perfect. Granted I practically ran in these out of the box with only a 3 mi test run prior, I am going to keep training in them for my next 50 mile in September, Run Rabbit Run, because my knees were happy. I had fresh legs the day after. That is why I switched to the Olympus trail from the montblanc in the first place! Thank you for fixing the sizing! I had to go a size too large in the 5 which caused hot spots and now I'm in my regular size with no blisters. This is a much better fit! I had no ankle rolling issues, they really hug rocks just right and I felt beyond stable running down hill. At 30 degrees temp the sole felt a little stiff, but they got softer as the day warmed up. I could walk in these all day. Dying to try the new Montblanc Carbon next!
review.name: 50 mile Leadville run

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently had the opportunity to test the Olympus 6 while thru hiking the Tahoe Rim Trail, thanks to Altra giving me a free pair to try. As a long time Altra wearer, I was excited to test out new shoes while actually backpacking, as I typically wear trail runners for hiking and I've noticed that trail running shoes can perform very differently depending on if I'm wearing them specifically for running or hiking. All in all, these performed pretty well. The high cushioning level was nice for longer 20+ mile days on variable terrain (including smooth dirt, as well as loose rock). The original footshape is great for having a wider toe box and plenty of space for the feet to move naturally. The shoes are highly breathable, but did end up having a lot of dust work through the mesh and through my socks. The Vibram tread was great for extra grip, but the section without Vibram tread definitely got shredded up in less than 50 miles. The heel cup did cause a lot of pinching around my heels though, which I've never had to this degree in an Altra shoe, as well as some burning around my heels (similar to the Timp 4). I put about 200 miles on the shoes in two weeks with constant use and the shoes held up pretty well all around. I'm looking forward to testing these out on trail runs next to see how the experience compares. If you're looking for a comfortable trail shoe, especially for thru hiking, the new Olympus 6 is a solid option.
review.name: Solid Option for Thru Hiking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Hi! This is a review from a trail runner who prefers ground feel and minimal stack height! I've also completed several trail ultras and marathons (trail and road) in minimal footwear. I wanted to see how this particular max cushion, high stack zero drop shoe would perform and provide comfort given an injured left heal. I have also worked in run specialty shops. I was so happy to be selected to test the Altra Olympus 6 with my particular preferences. I gave this model 5-Stars because I would and will absolutely continue to rotate this model on training runs. Especially on buffed trails, for hill repeats, hikes and any time I'm feeling like I want a bit more cushion than I prefer. I would recommend this model over other high stack, max cushion models/brands bc of its responsiveness. Sizing and On Foot Feel: I requested a size 8. I am still torn if I would have felt even more secure and comfortable in a 7.5. Regardless of that, I love how they feel around the midfoot, feel secure. I just would like to get them a little more snug around the midfoot, hence why I think a 7.5 would have been perfect. Of course, I love the ample toe box space, so my toes can fully splay, but at the same time not getting smashed into the front of the shoe when going downhill. I should also mention the heel feels pretty secure as well, not too tight, but not loose, either. Under Foot Feel and Performance: This shoe is responsive and not over the top bulky. The cushioning is comfortable without being too "squishy". I think that, not too squishy feel, helps reduce the perception of being on such a thick stack. Which I was concerned about b/c I though I'd feel "wobbly" or have a sensation of slipping off the foot-bed. I didn't get that sensation, and that was a big positive! Activities I Tested the Olympus with: Walks with the dog, hikes, runs, hill repeats, and even a morning of race timing. Surface tested on; Trails that transition quickly between buffed and bEAST Coasty (rocks, roots, boulders). Hill repeats on a look out access road; transitions between asphalt and crushed stone surfaces. What I Enjoyed Most: I LOVED the performance of the shoes during hill repeats; security around mid-foot and the cushion for the downhill abuse on the soles of the feet. I will keep using them on those days. As well as for longer trail run days at a local nature preserve surrounded by miles and miles trails of every kind of surface. (ALTRA gave me this free product to try.)
review.name: Perspective on Max Cushion from a Min Cushion Lover

name: Olympus 6 Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my son and he loves it. I’m impressed with the quality of materials and craftsmanship. The materials are noticeably better than the cheap puffers. This one has 600 fill power and I like how it is distributed so it can’t bunch up. Also like how the sides have just regular insulation. It makes the jacket more sleek looking while still keeping down in the places that matter. Great looking jacket and should be very warm. I’d say it fits on the larger side. Highly recommend.

review.reviewBody: Fit like a glove. Only draw back is they’re just a touch too tight and make my temples sore if worn for a long time. Other than that they’re great. Lenses are amazing
review.name: Fit like a glove. Only

review.reviewBody: I am obsessed with the lens quality and clarity. The notched corners add style but also ensure a comfortable fit under a visor or brimmed hat. The translucent frame adds a pop of color but isn’t so flashy that it’s distracting. Soft frame, super comfortable and grippy pads in the nose and temple keep it snug. Perfect for hikes and nature walks.
review.name: Summer fave

review.reviewBody: I own several Smith sunglasses and this is my favorite lens! I use these sunglasses for everything, the brown lens is the perfect for all activities including just driving. I like the style as it fists my medium size face perfectly. I lost a pair so I quickly bought another.
review.name: Perfect everyday sunglasses

review.reviewBody: Look great and feel great, nice and durable too, I recommend!

review.reviewBody: The lightweight fleece interior and brushed exterior appear as durable and can be used when active or bopping around. Hood was great as well as pockets.
